job_description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Performance Media Analytics team, you won't just analyse data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions:
• Client insights: you will analyze complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
• Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
• Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership teams
• Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
• Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company.

Your Work Environment:
• Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
• A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
• Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!
Who You Are:
• A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
• Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
• Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
• Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
• Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.

We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!​
Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.
Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

job_description:
We are currently looking for freelance / independent contractors to join our community of Data Analyst in Map Applications. This role offers flexible opportunities with competitive rates. The position will allow you to work from home with a schedule that minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

Peroptyx is a provider of data and evaluation solutions used by global technology and financial enterprises to build the most locally relevant, safest and intuitive online services for their customers.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Data Analyst in Map Applications, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you! We are currently looking for freelancers as

Data Analyst - Map Evaluator (home office)
Part-time position, freelancer/self-employed basis, home office

The Role
· You will complete tasks related to online maps and route planning for Spain.
· You will classify/evaluate the data in relation to these tasks.
· You will use online tools to examine the accuracy of geographic queries, addresses and routes.
· To qualify for this position, you will first need to successfully complete an online entrance exam.

Ideal Candidate
• Fluent in Spanish and English.
• Excellent research skills.
• Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
• Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Spain
• Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements
• Must be living in Spain for the last 5 consecutive years.
• Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
• Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
• Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
• Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
• Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
• All products will be provided at your own expense
• Only one member per household may apply

Benefits
• Work up to 20 hours per week. #homeoffice #nationwide #backtowork #
• Earn a competitive rate of pay.
• Develop your research skills.
• Avoid the long commute.
• Work from the comfort of your home office.
• Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!

Are you looking for flexible working hours? Would a second income or rewarding experience come in handy as a career booster? Then apply now!

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

Additional information:
Employment type: Part-time

job_description:
About the Role

Amazon Spain Services, S.L.U. is seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Tax Data Management Solutions team. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a key role in providing data stability, reliability, and innovative solutions that are scalable and reduce manual work.

The ideal candidate will have substantial experience in data management or business analytics work, with a strong background in tax, finance, or a related analytical field. You will be responsible for supporting indirect tax colleagues with data requests, data questions, and extracting data on their behalf, where standard reports do not meet their requirements.

You will also be expected to improve existing processes by automating and reducing manual work, collaborate with our technology partners to innovate and maintain complex business and data solutions, and implement projects to optimize data operations.

The Tax Data Management Solutions team is focused on providing exceptional customer experience and delivering solutions that create long-term value and operational scale. We are looking for a talented individual who can make business recommendations and influence stakeholders, with experience delivering cross-functional projects and creating business intelligence reports.

Key Responsibilities
• Support indirect tax colleagues with data requests, data questions, and extracting data on their behalf.
• Improve existing processes by automating and reducing manual work.
• Collaborate with our technology partners to innovate and maintain complex business and data solutions.
• Implement projects to optimize data operations.
• Translate business requirements into technical specifications.
• Work with our key technology providers to support technology upgrades, migrations, etc.
• Create and maintain dashboards used by tax compliance.

Requirements
• Substantial experience in data management or business analytics work.
• Substantial experience in tax, finance, or a related analytical field.
• Intermediate/advanced SQL query writing skills.
• Experience creating business intelligence reports.
• Advanced Excel skills.
• Experience delivering cross-functional projects.
• Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders.
• Bachelor's degree.

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with Spain SII (Immediate Supply of Information) electronic reporting.
• Experience using Python for data transformation and data analysis.

job_description:
Our Team:
Vista's Engineering organization is working to make our company one of the world's most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes analysts, product owners, technologists, data engineers and more - all passionate about providing Vista with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. Engineering team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers. Find out more at https://vista.io/
Vista has a catalog of thousands of products that can be customized in multiple ways. As a consequence, we have many data challenges and opportunities that we work with daily. The Assortment team is dedicated to simplify and advance Product Assortment related decisions. To achieve this purpose, we work closely with several business partners to create relevant data products powered by our expertise in the product data model. Our focus lies in developing easy-to-use solutions that enable data-driven decision-making to ultimately provide the best customer experience related to assortment of products
What You Will Do:
As a Senior Analytics Engineer, you will analyze data sets related to Vista's product assortment, creating visuals to help stakeholders understand product performance. You'll also assist your team in understanding data flows and identifying gaps to improve system and operational processes. The insights generated will help the Product Assortment team solve customer and business problems and explore new opportunities.
Possible workstreams you might be involved in based on current ongoing work include:
• Analyzing inventory levels in manufacturing and vendor plants and using historical sales data and market trends to optimize inventory.
• Identifying stockouts to aid the Product Operations team in improving logistics.
• Collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement inventory strategies aligned with business goals.
• Evaluating new products' performance and identifying low-performing items to streamline operations and reduce costs.
• Monitoring variable cost changes to help the Pricing team maintain margins.
• Providing data analysis on product characteristics to support Product Marketing and Operations in making informed decisions.

Your Qualifications:
At Vista, we are striving to hire individuals that add new ideas and perspectives to our teams and enhance our culture. No matter your background or work experience, we strongly encourage you to apply-even if you feel that you don't meet the exact requirements or have the same qualifications. You might be a great candidate for this or other opportunities.
• Proficient in SQL queries. You have data visualization experience (ideally in Looker, Tableau, Power BI or similar).
• 2+ years experience in an analytics environment
• Strong problem-solving skills (Ability to translate a business ask into a very concrete question and breakdown into important analyses)
• Comfortable with programming languages for producing analysis(e.g., Python,R)
• Compelling communication and storytelling skills (Articulate your message clearly based on your audience)
• Demonstrate VistaBehaviours ( https://careers.vista.com/how-we-hire/ )

Nice to Have:
• Experience with Optimizely, Statsig, or similar experimentation tools.
• Experience in designing/monitoring and analyzing experiments (A/B, multi-variant, Bayesian, multi-arm-bandit) using statistical rigor and being able to guide collaborators on how to accurately interpret the test results.
• Skilled in exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and are driven to find important patterns and trends in the data.

Why You'll Love Working Here:
There is a lot to love about working at Vista. We are an award winning Remote-First company. We're an inclusive community. We're growing (which means you can too). And to help orient us all in the same direction, we have our Vista Behaviors which exemplify the behavioral attributes that make us a culturally strong and high-performing team.
About Us:
Vista is the design and marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For over 20 years we've been inspired by small businesses, and we work incessantly to deliver solutions to their evolving needs. VistaCreate, 99designs by Vista and VistaPrint, all under the parent brand Vista, represent a full-service design, digital and print solution, elevating small businesses' presence in physical and digital spaces and powering them to achieve success. Vista is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.
Commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion:
Vista exists to help our customers live their dreams. Each dream is unique - and the Vista team needs to be as well. We believe in the unique contributions of everyone within a diverse global organization. We are collaborative, inclusive, and innovative. We strive to role model and live an inclusive culture of fairness, respect and belonging for all. And we work together to empower each other, creating a space in which each of us can spark our next great idea.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Vista, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.
#LI-KK1
Job Segment: Manufacturing Engineer, Data Analyst, Data Modeler, Database, SQL, Engineering, Data, Technology

• *Job Summary:** Freelance Online Data Analysts are needed to improve digital maps used by millions of users globally, requiring detail-oriented individuals with good knowledge of national and local geography.

We are hiring freelance English & Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
• Verify and compare data in a web-based environment
• Determine the relevance and accuracy of information
• Complete research and evaluation tasks

The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed.
• Full Professional Proficiency in English and Spanish
• Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
• Familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Spain

This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks. You must be 18 years or over and willing to learn and adapt to changing guidelines and tasks.
• Remote work & location independence
• Complimentary well-being package, encompassing a wealth of well-being resources
• Be part of an online community

job_description:
Calling all Graduates! Are you looking for an opportunity to kickstart your career with industry leading training and mentoring? If so, then look no further…

We’re looking for Graduate Business Data Analysts to join our two-year Graduate programme, giving you experience working in a FTSE 100 listed software company.
Everything we do at Sage is designed to help business flow, to help business’ make decisions faster and more accurate. As part of this, we rely on our team of experts to create, develop and maintain industry leading products. And that’s where you come in!

We’re on the hunt for our future top talent who can bring their skills and expertise to continue to drive us forward.

What’s in it for you?

Data is at the heart of everything that Sage does, and the BI and Analytics Hub works horizontally across Sage to make sure we use data and insight to deliver our purpose to knock down barriers and create connections and opportunities for customers and colleagues. The BI and Analytics Hub supports designated teams to become a franchise, enabling them to produce value-driven data products, enhancing Sage’s capabilities in business intelligence and analytics to advance Sage’s overall data strategy.
You will work closely with a wide range of stakeholders to define and translate business needs in to project and data requirements. You’ll perform data analysis and create visualisations using data storytelling techniques, using your skills to contribute to various success factors such as revenue and cost reduction, productivity savings, reduction of risk and contribution to our ESG agenda.

Throughout the 2-year Graduate programme and your career at Sage, we want you to be enthusiastic about your personal development, and continuously learn new things to strive for excellence. We expect a lot from our Graduates and will encourage you to bring innovative ideas to add real value for our customers, in an environment where ambition for future progression is rewarded.Responsabilidades principalesWhat are we looking for?

You’ll need to be a Graduate, and whilst we’re open to any degree discipline, you’ll need to be business minded, ideally with project management or process improvement understanding.

Alongside this, you’ll also have

• A keen eye for detail and an inquisitive mind to help problem solve.
• You’ll be resilient and determined, able to work in a fast paced, changing environment.
• As part of a global business, you’ll be an effective communicator, able to collaborate with people from across the world.
• Adept at requirement gathering and the ability to collect, organise and disseminate large amounts of data.
• Able to present data and explain complex analyses in a clear manner.

These roles are based in Barcelona. You’ll be in the office at least 2 days a week so will need to live in (or be willing to relocate to) an easily commutable distance.

Why you would love to join us?

• Great salary and performance annual bonus

• We take great pride in offering a comprehensive and structured development program, which includes engaging weekly training sessions designed for our Sage Ignite graduates.

• Diverse and Inclusive Work Environment, at Sage we are proud in encouraging a collaborative and inclusive workplace that celebrates diversity. Our Barcelona office is a vibrant multicultural environment, representing over 23 nationalities.

• We offer work-away program where employees have the chance to work from various locations around the world, this benefit is great way to enhance your professional experience and promote a global mindset.

• Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and technologies.

• Community: Make a difference to communities we live and work in, with your 5 volunteer days every year. How we are making a difference
https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/sage-foundation/

• Continuous Development: Unlimited access to Linkedin Learning and Sage University.

Career Growth: Long-term prospects for a professional career. Access to Talent Marketplace, an internal system that uses artificial intelligence to create a clear path for growth.

• Brand office space, locates at the heart of Barcelona’s 22@tech district, with great transport links.

• Reduced working hours on Fridays and in the summer (July and August).

• Flexible benefits that suit your needs.

What you can expect from the process:

1. Apply online with CV
2. Complete screening and video interview (You will receive a link to complete a video interview from the Outmatch platform)
3. If successful at video interview stage, you will be invited to attend an assessment centre in the summer (the first week of September).
4. Successful candidates will join us on 1 October 2024

Please note that due to the high volume of applications, there will be a delay in receiving a response from your video interview. We thank you for your patience.

Here at Sage, we are committed to inclusivity for all, so if there any adjustments that would help you thrive in the application process or beyond, please reach out to us at earlycareers@sage.com

Apply today!

#LI-KB1FunctionProduct DeliveryCountrySpainOffice LocationBarcelonaWork Place typeHybridAdvertWorking at Sage means you’re supporting millions of small and medium sized businesses globally with technology to work faster and smarter. We leverage the future of AI, meaning business owners spend less time doing routine tasks, like entering invoices and generating reports, and more time pursuing their ambitions.

Our colleagues are the best of the best. It’s why we were awarded 2024 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor. Because to achieve extraordinary outcomes, we need extraordinary teams. This means infusing Sage with people who knock down barriers, continuously innovate, and want to experience their potential.
Learn more about working at Sage: sage.com/en-gb/company/careers/working-at-sage/
Watch a video about our culture: youtube.com/watch?v=qIoiCpZH-QE

We celebrate individuality and welcome you to join us if you embrace all backgrounds, identities, beliefs, and ways of working. If you need support applying, reach out at careers@sage.com.
Learn more about DEI at Sage: sage.com/en-gb/company/careers/diversity-equity-and-inclusion/

job_description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Analyst with focus on Sales Analytics to join our team. The successful candidate will continue to build our data-driven approach to Go To Market & Sales through efforts including: clear, insightful reporting, proactive identification of new opportunities, and closely monitoring and evaluating performance. The role requires:
• strong analytical skills, including experience with SQL and spreadsheets,
• a good understanding of the sales business,
• and working closely with the Go To Market team to interpret and communicate data in meaningful, actionable ways.

Responsibilities:

Use data and insights to improve sales performance and provide greater clarity and understanding of the performance of the sales process. This will likely include:
• Lead overall development of pre-sales and post-sales intelligence, containing dashboards, reports and insights.
• Proactively interpret data to provide insights and identify areas for improvement
• Provide data and ad-hoc analyses to the sales team and management as needed
• Work with our Management on the creation of a data-driven Sales Strategy and Vision
• Contribute to creating revenue plans including headcount and pipeline plans
• Cooperate with our Go To Market Operations team in facilitating and driving regular cadencies (reviews of Pipeline, QBRs, Targets etc.) as well as improving overall sales funnel intelligence
• Work with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and drive critical thinking to challenge the status quo
• Work with our Data Engineering team to connect different sales touch points with our product data

What we are looking for:
• Minimum 5 years of experience in Data / Business Analytics / Sales Operations / Consulting
• Excellent in English language
• A proactive approach and genuine curiosity to understand and share what the data means.
• Ability to work in collaboration with others across the business to turn data to insights to drive action
• Strong understanding of Sales, Customer Success, and Go-To-Market processes and metrics (i.e ARR, Churn, ACV, Revenue and Pipeline Conversion Rates, etc)
• Understanding of the typical SaaS customer lifecycle journey from acquisition to retention and expansion
• Good technical skills and experience, comfortable with spreadsheet analysis, SQL code, and building dashboards.
• Experience with CRM tools and their Databases (like Salesforce, SAP or Pipedrive) and Customer care tools (like FreshDesk, Custify etc.)
• Eager to use new technologies, tackle new challenges, flourish in a fast-paced environment and contribute to our data-driven culture.

What we offer:
• 📈 RSUs grant in a rapidly growing company raising its value every day
• 💸 Annual bonus
• 🌎 Multinational team with 42 nationalities creating the future of automation
• 🎓 Learning & Development plan (online language, professional courses, conference tickets and other trainings) & 2 Company Learning Days per year
• 🌳3 Company Impact Days per year
• 🍎 Notebook/Macbook and 34’’ curved monitor
• 🏝 25 days of vacation, 4 sick days
• 🫶 10 care days to care for your loved ones
• 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Extra parental vacation (3-6 months)
• 👶 RSUs grant for a newborn child
• ☂️ Life insurance
• 🏋️ Gympass
• 💳 Meal and transportation tickets, medical insurance
• 🥳 Team buildings, parties, and company events multiple times a year
• 🏡 Flexible working hours + home office

Join us on the ride!

job_description:
Company Description

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2023, Continental generated sales of €41.4 billion and currently employs around 200,000 people in 56 countries and markets.

Job Description

This global position requires collaboration across Marketing Communications, Business Intelligence and other Marketing departments for all business areas to support site enhancements, monitor performance, and to ensure analytics data quality to optimize the existing web strategy.

In this exciting job you will work on the following tasks:
• MarTech Analytics (Website, PIM, DAM): Setting up the centralized tracking concept for all tires brand websites based on KPIs in Google Analytics, managing and configuring the account for all accounts and Marketing technologies (as PIM, DAM). Managing the Consent Management Tool for cookies and legal settings. Building dashboards and reports and conducting in-depth analysis to provide recommendations for improvement.
• Marketing digital performance: Coordinating discussions and challenging actions with the markets and other Stakeholders. Supporting standardization of digital marketing best practices. Delivering reports and building dashboards based on key figures to support stakeholders such as Marketing and Communications Channel Management keeping track with their digital goals.
• Qualtrics Management (Voc & DMP): Managing our Qualtrics account. Training and supporting MarCom colleagues in their data management. Structuring and managing B2C voice of the customer to coordinate enhancements with product owners.

Qualifications
• Academic degree in marketing, communications, computer science, or an equivalent qualification
• Multiple years of experience working in web analytics, online marketing or related area
• Experience working with large content management platforms
• Expert knowledge in web analytics tools (e. g. Google Analytics, GTM)
• Project management skills
• Data protection and legal knowledge
• Professional working proficiency in English, no other language required
• Open to travel up to 20%, incl. business trips abroad

Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.

Additional Information

You will be part of the Global Marketing team for Continental Tires. You will report to the Head of Global Marketing Technologies & Digital Experience. The role is posted as located in Madrid (Spain), but other countries could be considered. The Global Marketing is intentionally diverse and location agnostic, we value potential and skills over location, reflecting a broad range of backgrounds and perspectives.

On top of that you can expect the following benefits:
• Continental Value Sharing Bonus
• Corporate Pension Plan (after two years of seniority)
• Flexible Compensation Plan
• Employee discounts on Business Schools and Tires
• Daily restaurant tickets
• 100% illness complement
• Recognition bonus
• Accident insurance
• Assistance at private medical clinic
• Co-financing of corporate medical insurance
• Teleworking policy
• Flexible timetable
• Irregular working day to care for children
• Office car park
• Fruits in the office

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

job_description:
Job Description

As the Junior Data Analyst on our team, you will be responsible for analyzing lead and customer data to provide insights and recommendations for improving marketing performance.

Key Responsibilities

1. Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources, such as CRM, marketing automation, and web analytics tools.

2. Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to monitor key performance metrics, such as conversion rates, CAC, ROMI, and marketing database engagement.

3. Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in the data that may indicate opportunities or challenges.

4. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, sales, and product, to understand business objectives and provide data-driven recommendations for optimizing lead and revenue generation.

5. Support data-driven decision-making by conducting ad-hoc analyses and answering data-related questions from stakeholders.

6. Continuously monitor and evaluate data quality and accuracy, and take necessary actions to ensure data integrity and completeness.

7. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization, and apply them to improve data analysis processes and tools.

Qualifications

1. A Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or economics.

2. 1-3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a marketing or sales environment.

3. Must have proficiency with SQL.

4. Experience using Excel / Google Sheets, and data visualization tools, such as Tableau a plus.

5. Familiarity with CRM, marketing automation, and web analytics tools, such as HubSpot, Salesforce, Meta, Google Ads, and Google Analytics a plus.

6. Attention to detail and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

7. Strong desire to learn new platforms and skills.

8. Not required, but experience with any of Python, Google Cloud, PHP would be beneficial in this role.

Additional Information

Logistics:
• Please note that unfortunately, we cannot sponsor visas for this role at this point in time. This role is based remotely in one of our European legal entities (or Brazil).
• This role reports directly to Nick, our Global Team Lead of Marketing Analytics.
• Please ensure you have informed your manager about your interest before submitting your application.

Preliminary recruitment process:

1. Intro call with our global TA team

2. SHL assessment (does not apply for internal applications)

3. 1h interview with Nick, your manager in this role

4. Business exercise to verify technical pieces, incl. a few days’ preparation time and a 60 min working meeting with Nick and Kate to discuss your thoughts and findings - exactly as if you were working here already :)

5. Brief meet-and-greet with Pietro and David

6. References and offer!

#J-18808-Ljbffr

job_description:
Trigyn has a contractual opportunity for Data Analytics (Power BI & AI/ML). This resource will be working at our client site in Spain.

Responsibilities:

1. The Business Analyst will undertake the following duties and responsibilities: - Facilitate customer workshops/interviews to collect, analyze, validate and document business requirements, processes, business rules and workflows; - Conduct options analysis and recommend optimal solutions to address stakeholder requirements; - Manage the translation of business requirements into functional and technical specifications; - Make business-related recommendations including viability of usage of existing IT systems and/or infrastructure and industry IT standards/solutions relevant to business requirements; - Plan, design and execute application testing, UA T and release management; - Perform other related duties as required.

Big data analytics; prediction analysis and trends forecasting, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, and Power BI.

Experience with Modeling, Regression Analysis, Prediction Analysis and Forecasting, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

We need a candidate who’s well versed in analytics and has expertise in data analysis, modeling, and forecasting trends. This should be evidenced with practical involvement in projects/applications involving processing and analysis of data from multiple sources using innovative technologies/methodologies/techniques including Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.
The candidate should specifically mention the type of data analyzed, the technologies/methodologies/techniques used, the products/outcomes, and the purpose of the analysis.

2. Education: Advanced university degree (Master's degree or equivalent) in Computer or Information Systems. A first level university degree with a combination of relevant academic qualifications and extensive experience in information and communications technology may be accepted.
3. Work Experience: A minimum of 5 years of progressively responsible experience in business analysis for IT systems design.
4. Fluency in English, both written and oral, is required.

For Immediate Response, Please send your Resume to Global-Recruitment@Trigyn.com

TRIGYN TECHNOLOGIES is a multinational IT services company with resources deployed in 25 countries. TRIGYN is an ISO 9001:2015, ISO 27001:2013 (ISMS) and CMMI Level 5 certified company. TRIGYN has offices in United States, Canada, Germany Switzerland and India.

job_description:
Company Description

With over 35,000 staff across 44 countries, Eurofins Scientific is the world leader in food and biopharma product testing. It is also number one in the world in the field of environmental laboratory services and one of the global market leaders in agroscience, genomics, pharma discovery services and central laboratory services

We are delivering high value services to our customers, relying on a strong network of laboratories, equipped with highly optimized IT solutions.

Job Description

As part of the deployment of our Eurofins LIMS solution over the South West Region, we need to change the IT-Systems of our Food laboratory in Murcia – Spain. The purpose of the internship is to assist the project leader during the project by:
• Identifying process changes in relation with system implementation
• Review laboratory testing offer so that it fits with the new organization
• Prepare data to migrate from the current systems to the new ones.
• Prepare change management within business

The internship is based in Murcia - Spain but the mission will lead the trainee to actively collaborate with colleagues from different locations in Europe and possibly travel over there. Ultimately the purpose of the internship is to implement, in relation with local staff and management, a new organization that will increase lab efficiency in a sustainable manner.

Qualifications

Profile:
• You are studying in one of the top high-school
• You have good communication and interpersonal relation skills in an international environment.
• You are at ease with distant communications leveraging a wide array of technologies
• You are rigorous and self-organized.
• You are capable to work closely with others (in dependency with local Business Analyst and/or Lean Manager).

Skills :
• Competence in process re-engineering. Knowledge in LEAN is a plus.
• Usual IT tools.
• Business Analysis and/or project management fundamentals
• English fluent. Spanish is a plus.

job_description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

As a Research Associate within BCG’s Data and Research Service (DRS) function, you will form an integral part of our European DRS team. Through the delivery of secondary research, you will contribute to BCG’s client work and knowledge base by supporting proposals, client cases and business or internal development initiatives.

You will clearly synthesize, package, articulate and deliver your findings in a timely and accurate manner and conduct research on commercial, multi-industry and economic topics. Excellent organization skills are essential for successfully managing a variety and volume of research requests by accurately summarizing data and facts into appropriate and timely output i.e. email, Excel, PowerPoint, Word. Along with supporting research products (i.e. news alerts, company profiles etc.), you will also contribute to knowledge capture and documentation.

#LI-ES3

YOU'RE GOOD AT
• Engaging with customers
• You will thrive learning in a rich, fast paced, deadline driven yet thoughtful environment that is customer focused. Working closely with more senior team members, you will engage with our Consulting daily with the aim to understand, scope and deliver accurate, timely and relevant data and information
• Thinking analytically
• You’re an organized thinker who commits to learning research analysis including methods, databases and tools, synthesis & packaging
• Working accurately in a fast paced, deadline focused environment
• You will have strong attention to detail by clarifying request objectives under direct supervision and discussing the most appropriate and timely research approach. You will do this whilst communicating directly with BCG stakeholders to evaluate and recommend the most efficient and successful research strategy per project
• Working well independently and in a collaborative team environment
• Working closely with fellow DRS colleagues, you will approach all interactions with the highest level of quality and customer service. You will also guide outsourcing partners in their research analysis and do quality assurance
• Seeking professional development
• You will welcome the opportunity to grow and learn in an apprenticeship culture where you can quickly build and expand your research knowledge base to the next level
• Communicating with confidence and ease
• You will be a clear and confident communicator, able to deliver messages in a concise manner with a positive disposition and you will help build a loyal customer base for DRS

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
• Undergraduate degree minimum (a preference for a degree in business, economics, engineering, sciences)
• Candidates with an educational/professional background in research & data analysis preferred.
• A strong appetite for research: You have a passion for uncovering insights through diverse sources, navigating databases, extracting and analyzing numerical data, as well as interpreting qualitative information from reports, articles, and other secondary sources to deliver comprehensive findings
• Understanding of (or interest in) one or more industries or functional areas, such as industrial goods, healthcare, energy, consumer goods, marketing, technology, public sector, etc.
• 0-2 years relevant working experience
• Excellent English, Spanish and a third language (German or French)

The Data and Research Services (DRS) is BCG’s research center of expertise. We collaborate with our consulting teams to bring advanced research capabilities to support projects and client, enabling them with solution-oriented research and accelerated insight generation

DRS works with both qualitative and quantitative data, conducting research and providing synthesized results from over 100 commercial sources, publicly available data, company and industry research, macro-economic, commodities and trade data

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

The Data and Research Services (DRS) is BCG’s research center of expertise. We collaborate with our consulting teams to bring advanced research capabilities to support projects and client, enabling them with solution-oriented research and accelerated insight generation

DRS works with both qualitative and quantitative data, conducting research and providing synthesized results from over 100 commercial sources, publicly available data, company and industry research, macro-economic, commodities and trade data

job_description:
How to Become a Freelance Data Analyst

The ability to use data analytics to make better business decisions is a valuable skill that’s in high demand. Freelance data analysts are capable of working with large volumes of data, processing it in its raw format, analyzing it, and arriving at certain conclusions for the purpose of organizational planning and problem-solving.

If you enjoy working with large volumes of data to glean insights designed to help client organizations with their decision-making, you might have what it takes to be a freelance data analyst on Upwork.

What does a freelance data analyst do?

Freelance data analysts work with client organizations by taking large volumes of data, cleaning it, interpreting it, and presenting it in order to answer a particular question or provide a solution to a problem. Data engineers typically work with computer software and programming languages like python to process data and deliver key insights to business analysts.

Data engineers also have a number of tools at their disposal, including SQL consoles, data modeling tools, statistical analysis tools, and business intelligence platforms. A number of business intelligence platforms, such as Tableau and Microsoft Power BI, enable freelance data analysts to deliver critical data and information in a way that is visually stunning and easily understood.

What skills do I need to become a freelance data analyst?

Clients hire freelance data analysts for their unique set of skills. When you’re on a freelance data analyst career path, no two clients or projects will be alike, but there are some common data analyst skills that clients look for in a data analyst role.

A data analyst job description will likely have some of these core traits:
• Critical thinking skills. While freelance data analysts use the latest technology and software to glean helpful information from complex data, meaningful insights and solutions would not be possible without first possessing critical thinking skills.
• Data visualization skills. Data visualization allows freelancers to present complex information with shapes, sizes, colors, and text, allowing clients to grasp information quickly and make key decisions without delay.
• Programming capability. While freelance data analysts aren’t required to be hard-core computer programmers, having familiarity with certain programming languages and being able to handle a straightforward programming fix is an invaluable skill to have.
• Familiarity with SQL. Large volumes of data sets and database work go hand-in-hand. By knowing their way around an SQL database, freelance data analysts can maximize their value, creating client solutions that handle large volumes of data efficiently and through easy-to-use desktop database tools.
• Problem-solving skills. Data analysis and problem-solving are virtually interchangeable. Freelancers that excel in problem-solving always find solutions to their client’s most pressing dilemmas. Whether through an SQL database or an interactive dashboard, data analysts can use their problem-solving skills to find answers to the toughest client questions.
• Project management skills. Whether building an SQL database or processing data through a business intelligence tool, project management skills are an essential capability for competitive freelance data analysts. Successfully shepherding a project from market research to product development will help you be that much more desirable to future clients.
• Attention to detail. When dealing with data, one wrong number can invalidate all conclusions and recommendations from a data set. It’s incumbent upon the freelance data engineers to make sure they pay attention to things like types of data and data sources to make sure the insights they’re gleaming are correct.

What are the core freelance data analyst job responsibilities?

While analyzing data and presenting findings are perhaps the most important responsibilities, there are other tasks data analysts take on when hired for various projects.

The core responsibilities freelance data analysts typically handle during an engagement include the following:
• Collect and analyze customer data to determine product and services preferences
• Oversee deployments regarding new processes and data fields for production
• Develop and manage all data visualization presentations for executive updates
• Technical skills to establish and maintain standardizations around data processing, analysis, and solution coding
• Ensure data accuracy used for reports and presentations
• Manage automated backup of all data housed across multiple database systems and engines.
• Collaborate with team members and other data scientists within the research department as well as stakeholders across the organization.

Should I get a degree or certification to become a freelance data analyst?

In addition to developing your skills via employer or client work, it is essential to obtain a degree and/or professional certification to help your Upwork profile stand out and ensure you have the most essential data analyst skills.

Some examples of popular freelance data analyst degrees or certifications include:
• Bachelor’s degree or master’s degree in data science, mathematics, finance, statistics, computer science, economics, psychology, management information systems, or an equivalent in a related field of study from an accredited college or university
• Certification of Professional Achievement in Data Sciences—offered by Columbia University Data Science Institute

Learn more here.

Available in Murcia, Spain

job_description:
Data Analyst Apprentice

Barcelona, Spain

Hybrid

We are looking for an apprentice specialized in data analytics. Join a dynamic team in a complex Supply Chain and work for a leading perfumery company. We'll need you to leverage data in order to optimize supply chain, drive efficiency and enhance decision-making. We offer the chance to join a worldwide company promoting careers internally.

At dsm-firmenich people are at the heart of the company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and value diversity in the workplace.

Your key responsibilities

• Collect, clean, and organize data related to the supply chain, including data on suppliers, inventory, capacity, and Row materials.

• Support regional IBP & operational processes, including inventory and supply chain management, Supply Planning, process management across AMET and EUR region.

• Analyze data using statistical methods and software such as PBI, VBA, Python, or SQL to identify trends and patterns in the supply chain.

• Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders, including senior management, developing dashboards to track progress over time.

• Identify areas for improvement in the supply chain, such as reducing lead times, improving inventory management, and cost saving.

• Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in supply chain management and data analysis.

We bring

• A rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;

• A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;

• A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;

• A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;

• Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected – regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;

• A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;

You bring

• Master's degree in Statistics, Engineering, data scientist, or equivalent.

• Critical thinking and proactive work style.

• Analytical skills.

• Pro-active, positive attitude, and willing to learn.

• Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and other data analysis tools, to create and operate reports.

• Knowledge is some code language software (SQL/ Python/VBA/M)

• English is must, French/Spanish is a plus

job_description: Join us on our exciting journey! Position Purpose Under guidance, performs data analytics activities related to complex business problems and issues to provide insight to decision makers. May provide analytic support for internal project teams and for external client consulting or services engagements. Essential Functions • Under guidance, performs basic quantitative or qualitative analyses to support the development of solutions for internal or external client project teams. • Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements. • May directly produce datasets and reports for analysis using existing IQVIA tools. • Verifies data for accuracy and completeness. • May manipulate and transform data to optimize analyses. • Performs audits of own work or that of others to ensure conformance with established procedures or to resolve routine issues. • May work with standalone data systems or enterprise-wide tools supporting activities such as inquiry resolution, data validation, and trend analysis. • Ensures the appropriate timing of the database updates. • Investigate client queries. Qualifications • Bachelor’s degree Req • 1-3 years of previous professional experience preferably working with pharmaceutical data. • Data analysis skills and working knowledge of Microsoft software tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Access). • SQL knowledge • Works willingly and effectively with others in and across the organization to accomplish team goals. • Knowledge and understanding of the fundamental processes of the business. • Knowledge of the methods, tools and techniques related to one’s functional area. • Knowledge of the industry and an understanding of the marketplace. • Effective time management skills. We invite you to join IQVIA™ Recognized by Great Place to Work as the third best company to work for in Spain (March 2020). FORTUNE Magazine's World's Most Admired Companies list for the third year in a row (January 2020). Recognized by the 2016 Scrip Awards as the Best Full-service Provider Contract Research Organization (CRO). You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there! Together with the companies we serve, we are enabling a more modern, more effective and more efficient healthcare system, and creating breakthrough solutions that transform business and patient outcomes. To get there, it takes diverse skills and a curiosity to explore new possibilities. No matter your role, everyone at IQVIA contributes to our shared goal of improving human health. Thank you for your interest in growing your career with us.

job_description:
Trigyn has a contractual opportunity for a Data Entry Clerk. This resource will be working at our client site in Valencia, Spain.

Job Responsibilities:

To safeguard approximately two million scanned/photographed documents, the scanned documents will need to be transcribed, digitalized, and entered in a fit-for-purpose Information Management System (IMS).
Under the direct supervision of the Program Officer, and in close coordination with the Head, PRD, the successful candidate will be responsible and accountable for data entry and quality assurance to facilitate accurate record keeping and subsequent technical analysis of HLP-related documentation.

1. Manual entry of data from digital images in the fit-for-purpose Information Management System (IMS).
2. Cross-check all data entered against the original source to ensure complete accuracy.
3. Identify and report data discrepancies and gaps in a timely manner.
4. Verifies entered data by reviewing, correcting, or re-entering data.
5. Ensures and maintains strict confidentiality of digital resources.
6. Undertake any other tasks assigned by the Supervisor.

For Immediate Response, Please send your Resume to Global-Recruitment@Trigyn.com

TRIGYN TECHNOLOGIES is a multinational IT services company with resources deployed in 28 countries. TRIGYN is an ISO 9001:2015, ISO 27001:2013 (ISMS) and CMMI Level 5 certified company. TRIGYN has offices in the United States, Canada, Switzerland and India.

job_description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.The Team:
You will be joining the Celonis Common Data Model team within the Product and Engineering department. Our mission is to build system agnostic data models for business processes using state-of-the-art object centric process mining technology in order to accelerate time to value for our customers. This team specializes on three aspects: Defining the ontology of the most common business processes, providing prebuilt transformations for such ontologies for major source systems like SAP, Oracle etc, and lastly, building a robust pipeline that facilitates content development at scale.
The Role:As a Senior Data Architect, you will own and focus on the first two aspects of the team’s goals. For short term, providing prebuilt transformations for existing ontologies (for processes like Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Inventory Management) for SAP, Oracle etc and validating them across our early adopters in our customer base. In the long term, defining and extending the existing ontologies with additional process context. In addition, you would also be responsible for maintaining the quality
The work you’ll do:

Research and design
Facilitate a Cross functional interaction with product managers, domain experts, engineers and consultants during the research and design phases.
Build data models for these defined ontologies and researched mappings using the object centric process mining methodologies with performant SQL transformations.
Test and validate the models in development environments and customer environments to gather early feedback
Document the data model governing principles and development

The qualifications you need:

You have that rare combination—a sharp technical brain and a head for business. You’ll use this to build a system agnostic data model for various business processes.
3-5+ years of experience working in the data field as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, Business Analyst or similar.
Experience working with data from business processes or ERP systems like SAP, Oracle is a huge plus.
Strong Solution Designing skills with solid understanding of business processes (supply chain and/or financial processes) and data beneath the ERP systems.
Experience with databases and data modeling, and hands-on experience with SQL.
Experience using Git for version control is beneficial.
Ability to work independently and own a part of the team’s goals
Very good knowledge of spoken and written English
Ability to communicate effectively and build a good rapport with team members
What Celonis Can Offer You:

The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us:
Celonis helps some of the world’s largest and most esteemed brands make processes work for people, companies and the planet. With over 5,000 enterprise customer deployments across nearly every industry, the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses process mining and AI to give you a living digital twin of your business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and empowers companies to reduce waste, create value and benefit people across the top, bottom, and green lines. Since 2011, the Celonis platform has enabled its customers to identify more than $18 billion in value. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.
Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Equal Opportunity at Celonis:
Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws. As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. Different makes us better.

Your Privacy:
Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’ Accessibility and Candidate Notices
Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

job_description:
Working at Freudenberg: "We will wow your world!" This is our promise. As a global technology group, we not only make the world cleaner, healthier and more comfortable, but also offer our 52,000 employees a networked and diverse environment where everyone can thrive individually. Be surprised and experience your own wow moments.

Freudenberg Sealing Technologies is a longstanding technology expert and market leader for sophisticated and novel applications in sealing technology and electric mobility solutions worldwide. Thanks to our unique materials and technology expertise, we are a proven supplier for demanding products and applications, as well as a development and service partner to customers in the automotive industries and in general industries. With our approximately 13,500 employees worldwide, we generate sales of about 2.5 billion euros.

Some of your Benefits

Flexible Work Models

Flexible Work Models: We allow for flexible work models to ensure both professional and personal success.

International Opportunities

International Opportunities: Grow in your career through international exchange and global job opportunities.

Personal Development

Personal Development: We offer a variety of trainings to ensure you can develop in your career.

Sustainability & Social Commitment

Sustainability & Social Commitment: We support social and sustainable projects and encourage employee involvement.

Safe Environment

Safe Environment: We strive to ensure safety remains a top priority, and provide a stable environment for our employees.

Parets del Vallès

Hybrid Work

Freudenberg Sealing Technologies S.L.U.

Be part of a forward-thinking company where your contributions make a significant impact. Collaborate with a dynamic team and work on cutting-edge data projects that drive our business forward. If you are a data enthusiast with a passion for innovation, we want to hear from you! You support our team as

Data Engineer (f/m/d)

Responsibilities
• Be part of a forward-thinking company where your contributions make a significant impact. Collaborate with a dynamic team and work on cutting-edge data projects that drive our business forward. If you are a data enthusiast with a passion for innovation, we want to hear from you!
• Your Impact:
• Design and Build Data Pipelines: Construct and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines to seamlessly integrate data from multiple sources.
• Data Acquisition and Storage: Develop efficient database solutions to collect, store, and secure data, ensuring accessibility and protection.
• Data Transformation: Create algorithms to convert raw data into actionable insights, aligning with our business objectives.
• Pipeline Optimization: Continuously evaluate and enhance existing data systems and processes for improved efficiency and reliability.
• Quality Assurance: Implement systems to validate and ensure the accuracy and consistency of data sets.
• Collaboration: Work closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to meet the organization's data-centric needs.

Qualifications
• Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
• Proven Experience: Demonstrated experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
• Skills needed to be successful in this position:
• Programming and Database Expertise: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, strong knowledge of SQL, and experience with both relational and non-relational databases.
• Pipeline and Data Tools: Experience in building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and data sets; familiarity with tools like Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Microsoft Fabric.
• Cloud and Infrastructure: Knowledge of infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform) and state-of-the-art cloud technologies, particularly the Azure platform.
• Team Player: Dedicate your creativity and motivation to the team’s vision, and work well within a collaborative environment.
• Communication Skills: Strong communication skills in English (German is a plus).

The Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion. Employment opportunities are available to all applicants and associates without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Additional Information

Jessica Schmid

jessica.schmid@fst.com

job_description:
Who are we?

Welcome to Welltech – a global leader in Health & Fitness mobile applications. With over 200 million installs and a suite of five innovative apps, we're dedicated to enhancing the health and well-being of millions worldwide. Over the past six years, our diverse and passionate team of over 700 professionals has been driving this mission forward. From intuitive nutrition trackers to groundbreaking fitness solutions, we empower individuals on their transformative journey toward optimal health and happiness.

Why Welltech?

Imagine making a global impact on health and wellness as part of our team! At Welltech, we aspire to become proactive wellness partners for our users, being in an ongoing process of training ourselves to become one.
• We grow together
• We lead by example no matter what your role is
• We drive by results
• We are well-makers

What We're Looking For

We are seeking a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to enhance and scale our Paid Social channels, with a focus on TikTok. This individual will leverage data insights on how to use the platform efficiently and drive strategic decisions in user acquisition, optimizing campaign performance, maximizing ROI and other metrics.

Key Responsibilities:
• Carry out complex analysis of datasets and conduct appropriate data validation
• Work with business requirements, detail them into analytical reports/ad-hocs
• Create dashboards and reports, define key metrics and monitor the integrity and validity of the data reported
• Reviewing marketing results to improve performance (like revenue increase, reach, or engagement)
• Collaborate with team members on business results and drive the impact of data-driven decisions

Required skills:
• At least 2 years in Marketing/Data analyst role
• Knowledge of SQL
• Experience with visualization tools such as Looker/Tableau/etc
• Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL/ELT pipelines
• Understanding of marketing metrics, funnels, cohort analysis, A/B testing
• Strong in mathematics and quantitative analysis with a passion for numbers and data
• Strong analytical and creative thinking skills and the ability to clearly articulate approach, process, and results
• English Upper-intermediate — verbal and written
• Understanding of UA funnel (knowledge how to work with SRN, non-SRN)
• Ability to work on several projects at a time, plan, prioritize and meet deadlines

Nice to have:
• Familiarity with MMP, GA4, Firebase, SKAdNetwork
• Knowledge of Python (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, etc.)
• Knowledge of data design/ data modelling

Candidate journey

⭕️ Recruiter call --> ⭕️ Meet a team member --> ⭕️ Skills assessment--> ⭕️ Meet the Leadership team

Why You'll Love Working at Welltech:
• Competitive Salary & Benefits: Your skills and experience are highly valued in our compensation package.
• Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive and engaging environment where everyone feels supported and inspired.
• Growth & Flexibility: We offer opportunities for career advancement, flexible work arrangements, and a healthy work-life balance.
• Innovation & Creativity: We encourage initiative and innovation, giving you the autonomy to drive positive change and shape the future of health and wellness.

job_description: CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact. What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model. Job Description Position Purpose In this role, you’ll design and implement data models that support mission-critical reporting, performance metrics and controls, and deep-dive analysis. You’ll collaborate with data engineers, data developers and data scientists to deliver impactful reporting and analytics to support and guide business strategy (translate data into information in order to achieve business goals). You’ll participate in high-visibility projects with huge impact on product development and process optimization. As the company grows and progress continually, you’ll help to establish and promote data standards and best practices, as well as design and deploy new data solutions to deliver value to the business Major/Key Accountabilities Design, build and automate business metrics to support strategic initiatives & projects using data as main enabler. Develop and deploy deep-dive analysis as per asset control requirements. Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis to see beyond the numbers and provide user-friendly outputs and actionable insights. Conduct explanatory data analysis through statistical analysis and statistical inference. Present data insights and deliver presentations with the goal of educating and championing a data informed culture. Monitor own completion of workload and meet objectives. Ensure best practices implementation to improve service to business stakeholders. Ensure insights are available to be used on internal processes. Propose enhancements on new/current tools (standardization, usability, workload). Create documentation about internal processes Measures Deployment of the analytic processes as per plan. Ensure analytics created cover business needs and provide value to stakeholders. Ensure analytics are delivered on a timely manner. Customer satisfaction Qualifications 1 year working experience in a similar role. Experience Ability to write, improve and troubleshoot SQL queries. Experience working in Python or R to perform data analysis. Ability to analyse, model and interpret data. Analytical background and expertise in transforming data into insights Comfortable presenting insights and interacting with senior management and explain complex ideas simply. Experience designing visual presentations to tell the story behind the data. Working on remote teams. Proved experience organizing own tasks (manage priorities, standardization, automation, troubleshooting and short-term planning) Skills and Knowledge Strong analytic skills. Strong service orientation. Effective written, verbal, and visual communication skills. Diplomatic and sensitive when serving customers of a different mentality and culture. Ability to work autonomously. Ability to work with remote teams. Driven by results. Ability to learn on the fly. Problem solver (troubleshooting). Accuracy and attention to detail Languages Essential English Desirable Spanish Preferred Education Degree and equivalent - Data Processing Preferred Level of Work Experience 1 - 3 years Remote Type Hybrid Remote We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to developing a diverse workforce in which everyone is treated fairly, with respect, and has the opportunity to contribute to business success while realizing his or her potential. This means harnessing the unique skills and experience that each individual brings and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class. Individuals fraudulently misrepresenting themselves as Brambles or CHEP representatives have scheduled interviews and offered fraudulent employment opportunities with the intent to commit identity theft or solicit money. Brambles and CHEP never conduct interviews via online chat or request money as a term of employment. If you have a question as to the legitimacy of an interview or job offer, please contact us at recruitment@brambles.com. CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact. What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model, for available positions.

job_description:
Highlights
• OTE (On-Target Earnings): $36,000 - $48,000
• Base Salary: $32,400 - $43,200
• Location: remote in Portugal
• Stock options

About Us

At Fundraise Up, we are reimagining the fundraising platform to create the most convenient and fastest way to donate to non-profit foundations. Our innovation is aimed at enhancing loading speeds, boosting conversion rates, offering diverse payment methods, and more. Each month, individuals worldwide donate tens of millions of dollars through our platform. We are the go-to fundraising solution for some of the world's leading non-profit organizations. The UNICEF, Barack Obama, the Alzheimer's Association, and many others leverage our platform for their online fundraising needs.

About The Role

We are seeking a skilled Financial Data Analyst to enhance our financial analytics and revenue metrics. In this role, you will optimize data-driven decision-making processes, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our financial data. You will develop advanced data analysis frameworks and manage our financial dashboards for real-time tracking of key metrics. This position requires strong project management skills and a strategic mindset to drive our business forward.

Key Responsibilities
• Own and manage main Revenue metrics of company - ARR (Internally called Analytical ARR or AARR), Run Rate, Processing Volumes / GMV
• Gut, redevelop, maintain and improve ARR complex algorithm
• Own Financial Analytics Tools (Primarily using Tableau, Salesforce, Google Sheets)
• Own Financial Dashboards (including but not limited to Company Wide KPI Dashboards, Board of Directors and Leadership dashboards)
• Support FP&A team in external Financial Reporting for Key Metrics and Analytics (Cohort Analysis, Net Retention Analysis, etc.)
• Support Finance related Data Hygiene, Alignment, and Reconciliation across Tools across company (Finance, GTM, Product)

Skills and Qualifications
• 5 Years experience in Data Analytics,
• Proficiency in Data Analysis Tools (such as Excel, Tableau, SQL, or Python)
• Knowledgable in Data Management tools (DBMS) and data warehousing concepts
• Excellent sense of organization, project management, timeline management and work prioritization
• Experience with Finance Analytics, but engaged with RevOps Analytics and Product Data analytics teams before
• General understanding of Financial Metrics, Accounting, FP&A responsibilities
• Experience working across cross functional data analytics teams
• Experience with GTM and Sales Tools (Salesforce)
• Experience working in a high growth tech start-up
• Proficient in both English and Russian languages

Benefits

Our compensation package includes comprehensive benefits and perks, meaningful equity, and a competitive salary:
• 30 days off.
• Home Office Setup Assistance: the company offers assistance with purchasing furniture (office chair, office desk, monitor) and other items to create a comfortable workspace.
• English learning courses (50% reimbursement, up to $1,000 annually).
• Relevant professional education (50% reimbursement, up to $1,500 annually).
• Gym or swimming pool (50% reimbursement, up to $500 annually).
• Coworking (up to $250 monthly).
• Remote working.
• *Please note: All official correspondence from Fundraise Up will exclusively originate from the @fundraiseup.com domain. Exercise caution and ensure the authenticity of emails claiming to be from our company.
