job_description:
About the job
• The Derivatives Static Data Analyst guarantees and performs the daily control and monitoring of the Bank/Clients details in the internal systems, ensuring the client accounts are open in due time and the set-up is align for the Client to trade in Listed Derivatives, while ensuring the objectives and the best practices of the department

Your Main Activities Are
• Ensure Client account administration: opening, amendment & closing of client UBIX accounts based on Marketing/On Boarding & Client Services instructions formalized with a Client Opening / Amendment/ Closing form or by 2sworkflows ticket. Also ensure that all involved teams are accurately informed about new account openings and closings
• Contract reportable limits, Emir Reporting and GCM report monitoring. This is done in close coordination with Regulatory Reporting & Ops Teams
• Responsible for all the clearing Fees Management, set-up in internal systems as the needed updates
• Evaluate and update documented procedures to ensure they are complete and accurate
• Understand and get trained in all the tasks/activities related to the process; ensure the Knowledge transfer between the team on a periodic basis; and, participate on Brain Storming /Cross Knowledge sessions and share the best practices and ideas with the team members
• Interact with all needed internal and/or external entities in order to get additional information for unidentified entries; and, maintain Communication Channels with internal business teams
• Escalate unresolved open items to the Team Leader; understand the risks inherent to the daily activity and the existing Control Framework to mitigate the risks identified; and, take corrective measures/actions along with the Team Leader
• Seek for a constant automation of the processes, in order to ensure that the auto-matching rate for all sites is maintained at a consistent level; while identifying exceptions and out of balance situations, liaising with internal departments to reach resolution in a timely manner

Profile and Skills to Success
• Bachelor degree in Business Management
• Up to 2 years of Experience in Banking and Financial Operations
• Proficiency in MS Office Pack Microsoft Excel
• Fluent in English
• Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
• Ability to deliver/Results driven
• Attention to detail/rigor

#LI-Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?

· Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

· Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

· International reach

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success. BNP Paribas holds key positions in its three core operating divisions:
• Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
• Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
• Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

· Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

· Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

· Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
• Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
• In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

job_description:
About the Job
• Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNPParibas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.

Your Main Activities Are
• Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.

job_description:
Overview

Are you interested in a career in PepsiCo? Are you passionate about Digital Transformation?

Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: join us as the next Sales Data Analyst.

Working with inspiring and experienced colleagues, you'll find that the atmosphere in our office in Lisbon is informal and engaging. With an active, get-things-done culture, this is a place where your dynamism and agility will make a difference.

Your mission:

Are you ready to take your career further? In this role, it will be your mission to meet both our sales data and systems while integrating it with the most innovative tools. You will collaborate with multiple colleagues from across the world in order to improve, enhance, and develop the ways of working of our wide Sales team. As a key player, you will take charge of sales system governance, data integrity, reporting, process enhancement, go-to-market capabilities, and cross-functional collaboration, driving efficiency and innovation aligned with business priorities.

Responsibilities

Your day to day with us:
• Harness the power of location intelligence to extract nuanced insights that contribute to strategic decision-making.
• Employ advanced skills in data cleaning, preparation, and mining to meticulously ready data for analysis, whilst uncovering concealed patterns within datasets, providing valuable insights that drive informed decision-making and unlock new opportunities.
• Utilize cutting-edge tools like Power BI to transform the data into visually compelling and impactful insights.
• Pave the way for innovation by exploring novel data sources, including digital and underutilized outlets such as APIs, open data, etc.
• Apply and advance knowledge of statistical tools, including Python, R, etc., for sophisticated analysis of extensive datasets.
• Stay ahead of changes and upgrades to ensure a seamless integration and operation.
• Collaborate and align with various stakeholders, ensuring the successful delivery of projects in line with business priorities.

Qualifications

What will you need to succeed?
• +2 years of experience in a similar role.
• Fluency in Portuguese and English. Spanish is desired.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to manipulate and interpret complex data sets.
• Proficiency in data visualization and analytical tools such as Power BI, Python, and MS Excel.
• Experience with database management and proficiency in executing SQL queries.
• Project management experience, including the ability to lead and execute cross-functional projects.

Don’t worry if your experience isn’t a perfect match - if you’re excited about the role, we’d love to hear from you!

What makes us different?
• Hybrid working model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
• Flexible work schedules & Work-life balance
• Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
• Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities

Being you at PepsiCo:

PepsiCo is an equal opportunity employer, committed to helping people lead healthier lives and supports workforce diversity. We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability.

Planet + People:

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is how we’ll transform the way we create value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people in the global food system.

job_description:
Company Overview 

We are a leading European online business services provider, dedicated to offering cutting-edge solutions to our diverse client base. With a strong focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, we are committed to expanding our product offerings and enhancing our market presence. The company is experiencing extremely high levels of organic and growth via the acquisition of new businesses.

  Position Overview 

We are building a new Finance Excellence Center in Lisbon (Portugal) to provide a complete finance service to our business. The company is currently implementing a new ERP tool across the group (NetSuite) and processes to improve and automate our Finance operations.

We are seeking a Finance System Data Analyst to join our team to support the implementation of the new ERP System and integrate data from all of the companies billing, payroll and customer billing systems. The ideal candidate will have strong data analysis and data integration experience, ideally in an environment where the ERP System integrates with backend systems in an International Finance Organisation, Excellence Center or Shared Service Center setup. The ideal candidate has the experience to be able to work hands-on, contribute to the setup of new Center as well is highly motivated to contribute to Continues Process Improvements.

Key Responsibilities: 
• Key contributor in the implementation of the new ERP System including the transition of existing businesses and the on-boarding of future acquisitions as required.
• Data analysis and management of the finance system, with responsibilities including:
• Maintenance of existing feeds from integration systems to the Finance ERP, including, billing and payroll systems
• Data analysis, investigation and changes to existing data feeds / transformations to debug issues and/or implement enhancements
• Data analysis and investigation of data feeds for new acquisitions, in order to understand the effort and timelines required to integrate these new systems
• Data mapping, cleansing and transformation of data feeds for new acquisitions
• One off data migration and setup of financial data for new acquisitions (incl. migration of opening balances, supplier data and other core financial information)
• Administration and ownership of the data integration layer (using our chosen iPaaS software -Workato), including configuration, enhancement and ongoing maintenance
• Capturing and managing a central backlog of ongoing data requirements and enhancements
• Co-ordination with external technical development teams responsible for integrating systems, to agree data feed requirements, interfacing contracts, interfacing method (API …etc) and testing and release of new features and bug fixes
• Plan and execute testing of ongoing enhancements to data integration feeds and the data integration layer
• Advise the business on practical ways to use of the solution to meet business needs
• Provide first line support to the Core Finance members that are using our newly rolled out ERP System and connection with several Billing Platform and Data Warehouses, including trouble shooting user issues, resolving system errors, escalating complex issues to stakeholders and work with internal and external experts on this.
• Collaborate with cross-functional team to gather requirements, resolves issue and improve the functionality of the systems., including the creation and updating of the overall Finance Systems Roadmap.
• Develop and maintain system documentation.
• Assist with special projects and process improvement projects as

Qualifications: 

Must haves:
• Bachelor's degree in IT/Computer Science or Data Science
• Min. 5-year hands on experience in implementing and maintaining data integration solutions in IT/Finance environment, ideally using a leading data integration iPaaS solution (Workato, Mulesoft, Boomi, Jiterbit)
• Relevant experience and track record in an international Finance environment / Share Service Center setup.
• Excellent communication skills for both Business and Technical subjects
• Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, with a proactive and entrepreneurial mindset.

Desired:
• Fluent in at least one other European Language

Key requirements: 

What questions can we ask as pre-selection:
• Shared Service Center or International Finance Experience
• Hands-on experience and experience managing and implementing data integration solutions for a new Finance ERP system

"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

“At team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.”

job_description:
About the job
• The Stress Testing Data Analytics (STDA) team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for the BNP Paribas Group. The team is responsible for the elaboration of the dataset that will be used as the starting point for modelling activities and stress testing exercises, which are crucial in granting the Group means to anticipate risks
• The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) is used as an end-user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines. Data visualization is also a part of the team's responsibilities, with Tableau as the main tool
• The team works in partnership with the IT department of the Group regarding the stress-testing platform. They support the team on a daily-basis and help with back-end big data engineering support and maintenance
• In this role, you will join the team dedicated to credit risk. Your primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, present data to see beyond the numbers and prepare the databases used for the projection of credit risk parameters for stress testing and IFRS 9

Your Main Activities Are
• Execute data collection, data ingestion, data quality, data preparation, data cleaning and data analysis
• Perform data consolidation in a strong control and analyses framework
• Develop dynamic and intelligent dashboards
• Work closely with our data providers and with our clients
• Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises

Profile and Skills to Success
• Master Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or related
• Advanced level of English, both written and oral
• Knowledge in
• Data Analysis / Engineering / Visualization
• SQL
• Python
• Risk Management
• Attention to detail / rigor
• Ability to deliver / results driven
• Active listening
• Ability to collaborate / teamwork
• Analytical ability
• Communication skills, both written and oral

#LI-Hybrid

· International reach

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success. BNP Paribas holds key positions in its three core operating divisions:
• Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
• Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
• Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

· Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

· Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

· Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
• Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
• In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

job_description:
Descrição do emprego

We are a dynamic, forward-thinking company that values data-driven decision-making and innovative solutions. As we expand our global presence, we are looking for a talented Data Scientist who is fluent in Georgian to join our growing team. This is a fully remote position, allowing you to work from anywhere while collaborating with a diverse, international team.

Habilitações

Key Responsibilities:
• Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
• Develop, implement, and optimize machine learning models and algorithms.
• Translate business needs into data-driven solutions and actionable insights.
• Collaborate with engineering, marketing, and product teams to drive innovation and enhance processes.
• Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders.
• Stay up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning technologies.
• Work with Georgian-language data, ensuring the quality and accuracy of analysis.
• Communicate findings and insights with stakeholders in Georgian and English.

Required Skills & Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
• Fluent in Georgian (written and spoken) and proficient in English.
• Strong understanding of statistical methods, data analysis, and machine learning techniques.
• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
• Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
• Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
• Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.

job_description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.

Job Description

Are you passionate about data analysis and visualization? We have an exciting opportunity for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data-Driven Intelligence team.
• Creation of reports/dashboards where information is easily available to users for direct consumption and presented in a user-friendly way
• Creating analytical capabilities, exploring and extracting knowledge from data.

Qualifications
• Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
• Experience with Data visualization tool (preferably Power BI and/or Tableau)
• Proficiency in SQL
• Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
• Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.

Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

job_description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Title and Summary

Manager, Product Data & Analytics

Our Vision:

Product Data & Analytics team builds internal analytic partnerships, strengthening focus on the health of the business, portfolio and revenue optimization opportunities, initiative tracking, new product development and Go-To Market strategies. We are a hands-on global team providing scalable end-to-end data solutions by working closely with the business and engineering teams. We influence decisions across Mastercard through data driven insights. We are a team on data engineers, data architects, business intelligence developers, data analysts and data scientists, and fully manage our own data assets and solutions.
• Are you excited about Data Assets and the value they bring to an organization?
• Are you an evangelist for data driven decision making?
• Are you motivated to be part of a Global Analytics team that builds large scale Analytical Capabilities supporting end users across the continents?
• Are you interested in proactively looking to improve data driven decisions for a global corporation?

Responsibilities
• Responsible for developing data-driven innovative scalable analytical solutions and identifying opportunities to support business and client needs in a quantitative manner and facilitate informed recommendations / decisions.
• Work closely with global & regional teams to architect, develop, and maintain advanced reporting and data visualization capabilities on large volumes of data to support analytics and reporting needs across products, markets, and services. Support initiatives in developing predictive models, behavioural segmentation frameworks, profitability analyses, ad hoc reporting, and data visualizations.
• Translates client/ stakeholder needs into technical analyses and/or custom solutions in collaboration with internal and external partners, derive insights and present findings and outcomes to clients/stakeholders to solve critical business questions.
• Accountable for delivering high quality project solutions and tools within agreed upon timelines and budget parameters and conducting post- implementation reviews.
• Serve as a primary point of contact for client managers and liaises frequently with internal Product Managers, Account Managers, Engineers to gather data or inputs needed for project work.
• Delegate and reviews work for junior level colleagues to ensure downstream applications and tools are not compromised or delayed.
• Serves as a mentor for junior-level colleagues, and develops talent via ongoing technical training, peer review etc.

Experiences
• Demonstrated success when contributing accurate, technically innovative components for analytics/ product development projects.
• Experience managing day-to-day cross-functional communications and collaboration to meet project deadlines.
• Demonstrated success collaborating with clients and effectively communicating project outcomes, methodologies, and considerations to key stakeholders.
• Successful track record in independently conducting complex analyses and guiding junior team members through complex/ ambiguous issues.
• Successful track record quality checking personal work and peer reviewing analyses of junior team members.

All About You
• 10+ years of experience in data management, data mining, data analytics, data reporting, data product development and quantitative analysis.
• Advanced SQL skills, ability to write optimized queries for large data sets.
• Experience on Platforms/Environments: Cloudera Hadoop, Big data technology stack, SQL Server, Microsoft BI Stack, Cloud, Snowflake, and other relevant technologies.
• Experience on Python, Spark, Hive, Impala, Scala, Cloud, and other related technologies.
• Experience in automating and creating data pipeline via tools such as Alteryx, SSIS. Nifi is a plus
• Data visualization tools (Tableau, Domo, and/or Power BI/similar tools) experience is a plus
• Experience with data validation, quality control and cleansing processes to new and existing data sources.
• Financial Institution or a Payments experience a plus

Additional Competencies
• Excellent English, quantitative, technical, and communication (oral/written) skills.
• Ownership of end to end Project Delivery/Risk Mitigation
• Virtual team management and manage stakeholders by influence
• Analytical/Problem Solving
• Able to prioritize and perform multiple tasks simultaneously
• Strong attention to detail and quality
• Creativity/Innovation
• Self-motivated, operates with a sense of urgency.
• In depth technical knowledge, drive, and ability to learn new technologies.
• Must be able to interact with management, internal stakeholders

Corporate Security Responsibility
Responsibilities
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must.
• Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices.
• Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed.
• Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
• Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
• Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
• Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
• Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
• Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

job_description:
Who You'll Work With You'll be based in our Lisbon, Portugal office. You'll be part of Digital and Technology CCN team.

Digital & Tech CCN brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. Colleagues in our global Client Capabilities Network deliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation. You’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to Agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You’ll typically work on data transformation projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.

You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-tech topics. Digital & Tech CCN has multiple Center of Competence (CoC) with members in each CoC supporting various service lines to bring deep subject matter expertise strengthening our client value proposition and delivery.

The Data & Analytics Transformation Center of Competence (CoC) is one such capability which supports multiple topics including Data & Analytics. The CoC serves as a global knowledge hub of expertise that owns, maintains, and deploys key proprietary knowledge assets. The CoC serves clients across the end-to-end data value chain, across each category (e.g., Data & Analytics (including AI, GenAI, etc.) Strategy & Use Case, Data Architecture, Data Governance & Operating Model, and Talent & Culture).

When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

Your impact within our firmYou will serve clients by providing primary research support to consultants in various data and analytics-related topics. Additionally, you will work on client engagements, as part of the client service team, by bringing expertise to workstreams or by delivering our data & analytics tools and assets.

In this role, you will outline and problem-solve with client project teams on their research requirements. You will clarify request objectives and determine the most appropriate, cost-effective, and timely research/analytics approaches. Additionally, you will conduct in-depth research using relevant, qualified resources (e.g., proprietary, and external databases, analyst reports, and expert interviews) and provide the relevant and most up-to-date information.

In parallel, you will support the global data & analytics practice leadership to build out the firm's capabilities with the creation or maintenance of assets and client events (e.g., Global benchmarks, Global Data & AI summits, etc.) to tackle client’s challenges to become a cornerstone of the global core leadership team for our Data & Analytics practice.

As you progress in your journey at the firm, you will have an opportunity to build and own assets that help accelerate our client delivery while also building expertise in one of the cutting-edge technology topics such as GenAI implementation, Data & Analytics strategy, Data on Cloud, Data Architecture, Data Engineering, Data Ops, ML Ops, Data Products and Operating Model to help our clients realize the value from data to transform their business.

You will work a hybrid home/office model and travel for events, client projects, and team connectivity events.

Your qualifications and skills
• Master's degree in IT/computer science, data science, engineering, physics, mathematics, electronics or equivalent
• 2+ years of relevant experience in enterprise data architecture, data management processes or technology, data engineering or data science is a plus
• General understanding and interest for digital/business technology
• Proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and relevant analytics/statistical packages
• Experience or knowledge of programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, PHP, Java, JS, C, C++, etc.) and relevant tools e.g., data visualization, data analytics, data catalog, etc.) or cloud providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCS, etc.) is a plus
• Team player with highly professional customer service orientation
• Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

job_description:
About Notify AI

Notify AI is a fast-growing martech scale-up founded in 2016. We're positioned as the 1st AI CRM solution for responsible and efficient omnichannel orchestration.
Our Mission

We're committed to helping our brands send the right message, at the right time, and on the right channel, while integrating with all marketing automation tools.
Your Role

As a member of the Data Squad, you'll have the following key responsibilities:
• Data Collection and Extraction: Gather data from multiple internal and external sources, ensuring consistency and completeness.
• Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Clean, transform, and organize raw data into usable formats for analysis.
• Data Analysis and Insights: Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that will support business initiatives.
• Data Visualization: Build and maintain dashboards and reports using visualization tools to present insights in a clear and meaningful way for stakeholders.
• Collaboration with Teams: Work closely with departments such as Customer Success Managers and Product Squad to understand their data needs and provide tailored reports and analysis.
• KPI Monitoring: Track and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular reporting to help guide business decisions.
• Reporting: Prepare presentations and detailed reports to communicate analysis results to non-technical stakeholders.
What We Offer

Work in an international and multi-brand context with teams in France & Portugal

Collaborate with the data team (engineers, scientists, analysts) to ensure the quality of our data and the production of our models.

job_description:
Join our Group Learning & Development team (L&D) within the HUB Group HR in Lisbon, a cross-functional department responsible for defining, managing, and leading the Learning & Development strategy for the BNP Paribas Group.

Thanks to its strategic positioning and expertise, this team develops cross-functional offers and academies to support the Group's major transformation projects and key skills identified by the Strategic Workforce Planning exercises. The scope of intervention covers both global and French levels, with a role of coordinating and leading the Learning & Development communities.

Mission

As a Data Analyst L&D, you will play a key role in accelerating the development of our central cross-functional offers, thereby supporting the Group's strategic transformation initiatives. You will join the Learning Efficiency Squad, where your data analysis expertise will contribute to optimize Learning & Development indicators while integrating innovative tools and data.

Main responsibilities
• You will carry out in-depth analyses to assess the effectiveness of existing L&D offers and propose recommendations to optimize them.
• You will promote strategic KPIs.
• Update the team’s Dashboard (facilitating the offer/producing new offers).
• You will produce reports on all L&D data (ex L&D Group Balance Sheet, Functions, Business Lines.).
• You will formalize the need for new DataVizualisation/KPI’s reports and work closely with the People Analytics teams based in France to develop analyses of L&D activity.
• You will perform user acceptance testing for the integration of providers into Learning Experience Platform (LXP).
• You will present Dashboarding (DataViz) functionalities to new L&D employees and raise their awareness of data quality.
• You will carry out controls on the quality and consistency of L&D data in collaboration with the People Analytics teams.
• You will actively participate in team Agile rituals, including sprint reviews, retrospectives, and planning.

Profile

You are an analytical, meticulous person with strong teamwork abilities. A first junior experience in data analysis and DataViz tools will be an advantage. You have good communication skills. Your English is fluent to collaborate with international and globalized teams. If you want to contribute to strategic projects within a major international group, join us!

Competencies

• Ability to synthetize/simplify.

• Communication skills - oral & written.

• Ability to deliver/Results driven

• Analytical Ability

• Ability to work with Agile practices.

• Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics - Business Analytics

• IT - Business/IT relationship/Acceptance Tests

• Data viz blending analytics Tableau (expert)

• Data viz blending analytics Power BI (expert)

• Database management Microsoft SQL Server (expert)

• English (fluent)

• French (is a plus)

#LI-Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees – including more than 145 000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

International reach

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success. BNP Paribas holds key positions in its three core operating divisions:

Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines

Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services.

Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional client.

Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
• Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
• In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

job_description:
About MoonPay 🌖💸

Hi, we’re MoonPay. We’re here to onboard the world to Web3.

Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratizing technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.

What we do

We’re the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 20 million people around the world now trust our products — just take a look on Trustpilot.

We’re also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.

But that’s not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. It’s taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.

So whatever your background, we’re sure there’s something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.

Locations Supported 🌍

Spain, Portugal, Romania, Poland, South Africa

About the Opportunity ✍️

This is an opportunity for an ambitious data scientist to have a huge impact across the organization, while working in a complex and rapidly changing crypto environment. We are looking for someone with experience or an interest in end-to-end “full-stack” data work, including: data strategy, analytics engineering, (advanced) analytics and data science. The main focus of this position will be to play a crucial role in supporting our Accounting and FP&A functions.

What you will do…
• Build robust data models and infrastructure downstream of backend services and external data sources, which support reconciliation, internal reporting, and ad-hoc analysis.
• Develop “The Ledger”, which tracks all our crypto and fiat movements from external data sources.
• Design, build and scale a MoonPay-wide approach to reconciliation for cash and crypto using both internal and external data sources.
• Conduct more strategic analysis on specific topics such as the Flow of Funds from both a cash and crypto perspective.
• Collaborate with the finance team and the crypto engineering team to conduct investigations into areas such as issues with crypto delivery.
• Working closely with accounting & finance to build custom tables & reporting to support their efforts.
• Communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences (across different teams).
• Collaborate cross-functionally with other teams on Product, Engineering, and Finance

About You 🙋

As a data scientist, you’ll be expected to work cross-functionally with different parts of the organization while maintaining a focus on Data and Finance. Being someone who can build robust data models to contribute to the current ecosystem of data products. We are seeking someone with experience or an interest in “full-stack” data work, from data engineering to data analytics.

Most importantly, though, you will embody the core principles that everyone here at the MoonPay lives by. Our “BLOCK Values” are at the heart of everything we do - and they are…

B - Be Humble

L - Lead with Empathy

O - Own It

C - Communicate with Clarity

K - Kaizen

What you will need…
• Advanced SQL, data modeling, and data visualization tools are second nature to you
• You have a deep understanding of the fundamentals of statistics and probability, including experience in conducting large-scale A/B tests
• You have experience of and/or interest in working with a finance team, or within a finance function
• You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment
• You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including finance managers, engineers, VP & C-level executives

Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.

Perks:

Equity package 📈
Unlimited holidays 🏝
Paid parental leave 👶 🍼

Annual training budget 💻
Home office setup allowance 🪑

Monthly budget to spend on our products 💰

Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless 🚀
Freedom, autonomy and responsibility 💪

Please be aware that MoonPay does not request an AI-led interview without seeing a recruiter or team member from MoonPay on video call. We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us. Please let us know by emailing recruiting@moonpay.com

Commitment to diversity:

At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. That’s why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.

MoonPay is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. Please inform our Talent Team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

job_description:
Envision Pharma Group is a Technology Enabled Solutions Partner for the Life Science Industry with expertise in Commercialization, Value & Access, Artificial Intelligence, Data Analytics, and Envision Medical Communications.

At our core, are our people, the manufacturers, and the patients our solutions impact and benefit across the globe. We drive growth through our innovations as an empowered, accountable, and entrepreneurial team. Our passion makes people healthier and happier.

Being part of a collaborative team means there's no limit to what you can achieve. With us, you can be a part of a growing company you want to work for.

The opportunity

As an Analyst on our team, you will work in a collaborative and supportive environment to create insights and value for clients. Team members are self-motivated and demonstrate flexibility to assist on a variety of tasks. This is a hybrid role with the office based in Coimbra.

How will you make an impact at Envision Pharma Group?
• Identify and address client needs: build relationships with clients; develop an awareness of our services; approach client in an organized manner; deliver clear requests for information; demonstrate flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks; communicate potential conflicts to a supervisor.
• Detect outliers in data and research to identify the cause of the anomaly.
• Setting up variance thresholds, determining reasonability of results.
• Prepare monthly and quarterly pricing and rebate deliveries by defined timelines.
• High accuracy rate and compliance with applicable legal requirements and policy and procedures serving as the foundation of the SOC controls and compliance.
• Reconciliation of payments or other finance functions.
• Interpret and analyse large datasets to develop solutions to support business needs.
• Support to ongoing process and system development, especially in times of evolving government and commercial program changes.
• Set-up and on-going workflow maintenance around internal and leading industry software.
• Ability to read, research, and understand guidance from US government programs and other agencies while retaining, applying, and growing your knowledge base.

Do you have what we are looking for?

Ideal candidates will have a strong financial background based on a combination of education, experience, or both. Competency with data analysis tools at a minimum; a background in healthcare, pharmaceuticals or Life Sciences is a plus, as well as an ability to rapidly learn and apply new concepts.
• CEFR English level B1 or greater required.
• Bachelor or Master's degree in Technology, Computer Science, Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, or related field.
• Experience working with large data sets or proficiency with data tools such as MS Excel is required.
• Experience with data tools such as SQL, Power BI or MS Access is a plus; proficiency preferred.
• Experience working with data analytical or data visualization tools such as Tableau and QlikView is a plus.
• Familiarity with database structures and ability to understand underlying tables.
• High degree of analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills.

#TogetherWeDiscover

We turn vision into reality. Our people are integral to our success and our values reflect the Envision philosophy where our teamwork helps us all grow and our enthusiasm inspires each other.

Our Envisionary culture is a special environment that gives every employee a voice the space to invent and the chance to excel. A place where, every day, people laugh, think, take risks, and are excited about the possibilities the day brings.

Explore your place at Envision. If you have the experience highlighted above, we would love to hear from you!

job_description:
Manager, Data Analytics-Portugal

Remote but must live in Portugal- Must be willing to WORK HOURS 12 PM- 8 PM GMT M-F

About Tillster
Headquartered in the USA, Tillster is the global leader in digital ordering and customer engagement solutions. For over a decade we have developed revolutionary self-service, ordering and payments solutions – for mobile, tablet, online, kiosk, call center, and more – creating personalized interactions based on consumer preferences, language, and currency. Our platform is compatible with 15+ unique POS systems, representing over 90% coverage in multi-unit restaurants. We offer one platform: one scalable, enterprise class solution – to create world-class digital engagement solutions. Our mission and passion are one in the same: Empower restaurants and consumers to engage and transact anywhere, anytime, and from any device - one consumer at a time, one order at a time, billions of times over. In doing so, together we are transforming e-commerce in restaurants and making the till grow for Tillster and our customers.

Are you a passionate data analytics leader with a knack for data accuracy, innovation, and a drive to deliver actionable insights? Tillster is seeking an experienced Manager to lead our Data Analytics team. If you have 3+ years’ experience growing and managing a Data Analytics team coupled with 5+ years of experience in data analytics for ecommerce, marketing/CRM, business or financial analysis, we want to talk with you. We seek a self-motivated, self-directed, structured, and collaborative hands-on manager for our data analytics team. At Tillster we build web-based, kiosk/on premise, and hybrid-mobile restaurant ordering technology platforms. You will be leading the data analytics group, within the broader Data Science team, which encompasses data engineering, data products, self-service data offerings and business analysis.

What you will be doing
• Lead and mentor a high-performing analytics team, fostering professional growth and driving innovation by integrating AI-driven solutions and evaluating buy vs. build options.
• Design and communicate complex data insights to stakeholders, ensuring data-driven strategies align with business and customer objectives.
• Collaborate in defining the data collection strategy and be the lead subject matter expert in Google Analytics.
• Champion the design, implementation, and analysis of A/B tests to optimize customer experiences and drive business performance.
• With the team, support ad hoc data analysis for Tillster customers, executives, and other stakeholders to surface patterns in the data and identify areas to improve KPIs (engagement, average check, coupon usage, loyalty usage, conversions, orders, etc.).
• Develop and update dashboards for business stakeholders such as Marketing, Product, Finance, Engineering, Account Management, and Support/Operations.
• Create new analysis explores to enable non-technical analysts to access data, build dashboards, and solve critical business challenges on Looker technology.
• Your responsibility will be to work in the data science team in data analysis of data collected by those apps.
• Build reusable services and components to add to our company-wide libraries in SQL, Python and Looker.
• QA and code reviews to ensure maximum quality and accuracy.
• Responsible for data product quality standards and validation test plans and test cases
• Work collaboratively with smart and passionate software engineers, data engineers, data scientists, BI developers, and other internal/external key stakeholders.
Requirements
• 3+ years as a hands-on manager, leading a Data Analytics team in a fast-paced environment.
• 5+ years of experience with data analytics, including the use of BI tools such as Looker or Tableau to drive business outcomes.
• Bachelor’s degree or higher in Data Science/Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field.
• Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams, manage multiple stakeholders, and communicate effectively across different levels of the organization.
• Expertise in data visualization that is clear and easy to understand.
• Strong written and verbal communications; including but not limited to customer engagement and presentations.
• Ability to find meaning in KPIs and a curiosity that digs deep when metrics do not seem to tell a full story.
• Skill at discovering actionable insights and communicating them effectively.
• Presentation style that fosters trust and customer confidence in both the data and Tillster’s capabilities.
• Expertise in advanced SQL, Big Query, Redshift, and/or Snowflake.
• Expertise with Google Analytics behavioral, engagement and ecommerce data; ideally you would have experience with custom metrics and custom reports on GA.
• Hands-on experience with Git (Bitbucket, Gitlab, GitHub, etc.).
• Experience conducting A/B tests and analyzing pre-post data under various circumstances.
• Experience in deep dive analysis with vague requirements to support creative discoveries that drive business value.
• Experience with data products, analytics, and data science in relevant area.
• Demonstrated success working in a collaborative Agile team environment.
Thriving at Tillster
As a member of Tillster, you will embody our core values:
· Put Customers First: Prioritize the needs and satisfaction of our customers in all decisions and actions appropriate to Tillster’s stage of development, resources, and stated goals.
· Collaborate: Work together effectively, leveraging diverse perspectives to achieve common goals.
· Innovate: Embrace creativity and pursue new ideas to drive progress and improvement.
· Operate from Data: Use strong critical thinking skills to make informed decisions based on accurate and relevant data.
· Drive Results: Focus on achieving tangible outcomes and delivering high performance.
· Own It: Take responsibility for your actions and the success of your work.
· Be Passionate and Have Fun: Bring enthusiasm to your work and enjoy the journey.

The Interview Process
• Recruiter interview with a Talent Acquisition Specialist
• Interview with Data Analytics Team
• Final interview with our Data Analytics Team Leader

Making a Difference in the Tillster Way
Our business and product mission is to empower restaurants and consumers globally; by empowering, supporting, and nurturing the people who are part of the global Tillster team. We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where every team member is respected, empowered, and encouraged to grow. To make this a reality, Tillster is dedicated to embracing diversity in all forms and is proudly an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, family/parental status, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status.
Follow us on:
Tillster: https://www.tillster.com/
Tillster Careers: https://www.tillster.com/careers
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/tillster/

Pay and Benefits (PORTUGAL)
• Compensation competitive to market and geographical location.
• Meal allowance for each day worked available through meal card.
• Home/Office allowance reimbursement per calendar month, pro-rated based on employment start date.
• Health insurance: Tillster pays the premium for employee private health insurance. Employees have the option to add their spouse/dependents at the employee’s cost.
• Holidays: Up to 20 federal and local/municipal holidays in accordance with applicable Portuguese Labour laws, dependent on your employment start date.
• Vacation: Up to 22 days of vacation every holiday year, pro-rated based on employment start date.
• Education, Learning & Development: We offer Udemy Learning courses; and ongoing learning and development opportunities.

Tillster is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer

No Visa Sponsorship

Principals only – no Agencies or calls please

About Tillster

Headquartered in the USA, Tillster is the global leader in digital ordering and customer engagement solutions. For over a decade we have developed revolutionary self-service, ordering and payments solutions – for mobile, tablet, online, kiosk, call center, and more – creating personalized interactions based on consumer preferences, language, and currency. Our platform is compatible with 15+ unique POS systems, representing over 90% coverage in multi-unit restaurants. We offer one platform; one scalable, enterprise class solution – to create world-class digital engagement solutions.

Our mission and passion are one in the same: Empower restaurants and consumers to engage and transact anywhere, anytime, and from any device - one consumer at a time, one order at a time, billions of times over. In doing so, together we are transforming e-commerce in restaurants and make the till grow for Tillster and our customers.

Thriving at Tillster

As a member of Tillster, you will embody our core values:
• Put Customers First: Prioritize the needs and satisfaction of our customers in all decisions and actions appropriate to Tillster’s stage of development, resources, and stated goals.
• Collaborate: Work together effectively, leveraging diverse perspectives to achieve common goals.
• Innovate: Embrace creativity and pursue new ideas to drive progress and improvement.
• Operate from Data: Use strong critical thinking skills to make informed decisions based on accurate and relevant data.
• Drive Results: Focus on achieving tangible outcomes and delivering high performance.
• Own It: Take responsibility for your actions and the success of your work.
• Be Passionate and Have Fun: Bring enthusiasm to your work and enjoy the journey.

Making a Difference in the Tillster Way

Our business and product mission is to empower restaurants and consumers globally; by empowering, supporting, and nurturing the people who are part of the global Tillster team. We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where every team member is respected, empowered, and encouraged to grow. To make this a reality, Tillster is dedicated to embracing diversity in all forms and is proudly an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, family/parental status, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status.

job_description:
About the job
• Themission of RISK is to provide Senior Management of the Group and of theOperating Divisions, with full transparency and dynamic analysis of the riskand clients managed by Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) and InvestmentSolutions (IS) business units
• RISKcontributes to the definition of the Group’s risk appetite, its riskdecision-making process and the optimization of capital allocation to supportthe development of the Operating Divisions
• RISKSystems team is part of RISK. Its mission consists in providing the Bank with acomprehensive capital markets risk system used to calculate market andcounterparty risk capital figures using advanced methods and to support theneeds of users for risk analysis, risk reporting and the credit process
• Inthis context, Operations team is a global team responsible for the productionof market and counterparty risk metrics to the RISK function. The team is splitbetween London, Paris, Hong Kong, New York, Singapore, Mumbai, Brussels,Montreal, Sao Paulo, Lisbon and Porto
• Operationsteam is in charge of functional support on market and counterparty risk systemsof the bank. The team in Portugal is focusing in particular on the qualityaspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues areresolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) aboutdata quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, andassisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs arediscussed
• Themission of Operations team is met by:
• Ensuringclients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of theservices provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningfulKPIs about our main services.
• Resolutionof incidents related to data quality.
• Regularcalibration of market variables used for the calculation of risk metrics.
• Streamlining,running, documenting existing processes that currently lack industrialisation

Your Main Activities Are
• Workon Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance Indicators about thequality of the data in our systems (statistics on timeliness and quality ofdaily risk indicators) and maintaining these KPIs
• Investigateissues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently.
• Tohelp on the regular analysis and update of the parameters used in riskmanagement systems (such as interest rates or FX rates). Help to explainValue-at-Risk movements based on recent updates of such market variables
• Providetraining and guidance to new users of the system where required
• Buildclose links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients

Profile and Skills to Success
• BachelorDegree in Business / Finance / Mathematics / IT or related
• Advancedlevel of English, both written and oral
• Knowledgein
• MSOffice Pack
• PowerBI
• Good marketand/or Counterparty Risk knowledge
• Attentionto detail / rigor
• Abilityto deliver / results driven
• Organisationalskills

#LI-Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?

· Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

· Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

· International reach

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success. BNP Paribas holds key positions in its three core operating divisions:
• Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
• Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
• Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

· Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

· Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

· Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
• Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
• In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

job_description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

As a Data analyst in Customer management, you will be the subject matter expert on our customers. Through analytics, we can improve our services and offerings, implement new strategies and campaigns, and forecast future trends based on existing customer behavior.

To be successful in the position requires balancing excellent analytical skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities
• Developing and maintaining customer segmentation models to identify and target different customer groups with tailored marketing offers.
• Monitoring customer performance metrics to track the effectiveness of new strategies.
• Conducting customer behavior analysis to understand how customers interact with products and services and identify opportunities to improve customer experience.
• Develop automated and interactive dashboards/reports that summarize customer performance, identify trends, and provide recommendations for improvement.
• Identify and interpret patterns, trends, and insights related to customer management.
• Collaborating with cross-functional teams such as marketing, sales, customer experience, and data stewards to develop and implement customer management ideas.
• Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations for development.
• Partner with the Data Engineering team to define and build reliable data sources.

Requirements
• 5+ years of analytical experience in e-commerce, retail, or other relevant industry.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data and translate it into insights and recommendations.
• Bachelor's degree in any related field: math, marketing, statistics, or computer science.
• Proficiency in SQL.
• Python/R.
• Experience with statistical modeling techniques.
• Familiarity with ML modeling and algorithms.
• Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (Power BI/Tableau etc.).
• Ability to work with large amounts of data and draw conclusions useful for business on their basis.
• Good communication skills and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Fluent English.

Soft Skills
• Good understanding of the business processes of the e-commerce company
• Ability to find points of growth / possible areas of optimization in the company's work and formulate action plans for implementing changes
• Mindset on an independent search for facts. Ability to deal with uncertainty in data. Ability to ask questions correctly and formulate clear answers to them.
• Readiness for continuous development, expansion of the range of professional skills, and automation of routine operation

What do we offer?
• Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
• Fast growing international company with stable employment
• Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
• Mental Wellbeing Program – the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions
• Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
• Free English and German language classes - Flexible working hours and hybrid work

Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

job_description:
At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office.

The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time / full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!

Ideal Candidate
• Fluent in English
• Excellent research skills.
• Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
• Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
• Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements
• Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
• Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
• Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
• Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
• Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
• All work must be of an independent nature.

Technical requirements to perform the work

Access to a laptop or computer which uses :
• A logon account unique to you
• Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
• Only one member per household may apply

NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

Benefits
• Work up to 20 hours per week.
• Earn a competitive rate of pay.
• Develop your research skills.
• Avoid the long commute.
• Work from the comfort of your home office.
• Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!

Apply Online Today!

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

Informações adicionais :

Tipo de contratação : A tempo parcial

job_description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.

Job Description

We are creating a new role of Data scientist /Data analyst as Artificial intelligence (AI) and data science are a lever for improving the group's processes. The major challenge for the Data scientist/ Analyst daily is to ensure business development, the improvement of the customer experience and operational efficiency including controls. To do this, it must support the transformation in terms of processes or pathways by industrializing models.
• Extracts and analyses data to provide information that allows the company to better manage its activities and anticipate its future needs.
• Monitor and coordinate the implementation of recommendations and local initiatives.
• Build relevant data-driven insights and analyses to prepare and support business and operation decisions.
• Communicate and present the conclusions of your analysis to other departments of the company through different forms (reports, dashboards, presentations).
• Define relevant KPls to monitor performance and build dashboards.
• Keep up to date with internal projects on artificial intelligence and analytics, to promote their work to PCMO on both the business and technological aspects.
• Identify use cases that bring value to the regions' operational platforms.
• Manage an AI project from start to the end. From identification of the needs to industrialization. This means framing the project, setting objectives and deliverables, monitoring IT & AI developments and governance, and ensuring that milestones are met.
• Make the link between all the stakeholders in the ecosystem of a project (IT, Business, Data Scientists, etc.

Qualifications
• IT language of his entity or project (Python and Other languages).
• ETL (Alteryx, Dataiku).
• Data visualization: Power BI.
• MS Office Pack.
• English: Fluent.

Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.
