job_description:
At Wellhub (formerly Gympass) (Permanent), in Lisbon, Portugal
Salary: €53.000 - €67.000
Expires at: ********
Remote policy: Full remote
Apply now for a career that puts wellbeing first
GET TO KNOW US
Wellhub (formerly Gympass*) is a corporate wellness platform that connects employees to the best partners for fitness, mindfulness, therapy, nutrition, and sleep, all included in one subscription designed to cost less than each individual partner. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 countries. At Wellhub, you have the opportunity to build a career in a high-growth tech company that places wellbeing at the foundation of its culture, and contribute to making every company a wellness company. *Big news: Gympass is now Wellhub
We are thrilled to announce our rebranding as Wellhub, marking a significant milestone in our journey. This transformation reflects our evolution from a "pass for gyms" to a comprehensive employee wellbeing solution. With our refreshed identity, we are poised to embark on an exciting new chapter of growth and expansion. We are elevating our offerings, including a new app experience and an expanded network of wellbeing partners. Learn more about it here . THE OPPORTUNITY We are hiring a Senior Data Analyst for our Martech team in Portugal As a member of the ever-growing Martech team at Wellhub, you'll play a critical role in maintaining a data-focused culture and helping drive unique strategic initiatives. In this highly malleable role, you will be responsible for developing and ongoing data operation of Wellhub's growth strategy, products, technologies, tools, and technical solutions. This includes (but is not limited to) defining and enforcing efficient operational processes, generating and governing business-focused dashboards, educating business stakeholders on dashboards and datasets, developing analytical insights and analysis and working with multiple global teams within the business to provide solutions as a strategic partner. YOUR IMPACT Develop recommendations and drive improvements to data standards, processes, and definitions within your business area; Work closely with senior leadership to translate business priorities into analyses and dashboards; Lead cross-departmental projects and initiatives with autonomy; Partner with team leaders globally by providing analytical insights through accessible business-oriented data sets and visual data dashboards; Be an active participant in discussions with various global teams and have a voice in the direction of the business; Identify insights that will impact the broader business by leveraging relationships with internal stakeholders across multiple functional areas; Consult with managers and team leaders; work with them to turn vague or poorly defined issues into clearly addressable problems/questions that are measurable; Live the mission: inspire and empower others by genuinely caring for your own wellbeing and your colleagues. Bring wellbeing to the forefront of work, and create a supportive environment where everyone feels comfortable taking care of themselves, taking time off, and finding work-life balance. Main requirements WHO YOU ARE
Relevant work experience in analyzing large data sets and synthesizing insights into actionable product recommendations; Excellent SQL skills required - ability to translate a business request into code that answers a question; Proficiency in Python for data analysis and automation; Relevant work experience in analytical roles within B2B and B2C marketing contexts; Expertise in lead management - ability to track and analyze lead journeys to improve conversions and align sales and marketing efforts, supporting revenue growth; Advanced end-to-end user journey analysis: ability to examine and optimize user journeys from initial acquisition through various marketing channels, guiding them through the customer funnel to conversion; Experience with managing stakeholders' requests, pushing for prioritization and impact; Ability to communicate complex data and technical concepts clearly and concisely to a non-technical audience; Experience building data visualizations (Tableau, Looker, Metabase, etc); Experience creating Data Tables for Departmental Consumption; A driven self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment; Passion for excellence and continuous improvement; strong execution and ability to drive work to completion; Ability to think critically by understanding problems quickly and being able to identify solutions/ Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical team members; Excellent English written and verbal communication skills;
We recognize that individuals approach job applications differently. We strongly encourage all aspiring applicants to go for it, even if they don't match the job description 100%. We welcome your application and will be delighted to explore if you could be a great fit for our team. For this specific role, please note that prior experience in Data Analysis using SQL and Python, experience working with data visualization tools and advanced/fluent English are mandatory requirements. Nice to have
The following will be considered a plus: Understanding of data pipelines, data modelling, and data architecture; Experience working with data engineers; Must be comfortable with unstructured, fast-moving and constantly evolving high-growth environments. Benefits & Perks We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and well-being of our employees. Our benefits include:
WELLHUB: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to find their passion too. Access digital fitness programs and online wellness resources, digital fitness programs, and online wellness resources for meditation, nutrition, mental health support, and more. FITNESS : Additional fitness subsidy to access onsite gyms and fitness studios. FLEXIBLE WORK: Choose when and where you work. For most, this will be a hybrid office/remote structure, but can vary depending on the needs of the role and employee preferences. We offer all employees a home office stipend and a monthly flexible work allowance to cover the costs of working from home.
Our offices are in Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Portugal, Romania, Spain, and the UK. You can work from any office or remotely based in any of these countries. FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: We give our employees some flexibility to adjust their working hours, letting them adjust their starting time within a range of 3 hours. PAID TIME OFF: We know how important it is to take time away from work to recharge. Employees receive a minimum of 25 days paid holiday per year with an additional day for each year of tenure (up to 5) in addition to annual holidays (including an extra holiday on your birthday). PARENTAL LEAVE: 100% paid parental leave of 12 weeks to all new parents (of both biological and adopted children, regardless of gender and parent's relationship with the co-parent) + 100% paid birth leave of 14 weeks.

CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development. CULTURE : An exciting and supportive environment filled with passionate individuals from all over the world You'll partner with global colleagues and share in the success of a high-growth technology company disrupting the health and wellness space. Our value-based culture of trust, flexibility, and integrity makes this possible every day.

job_description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

Responsibilities
• Comprehensive analytical support for the successful execution and optimization of key SEO initiatives, solution development, and data interpretation.
• Collaborate closely with the SEO teams to build comprehensive measurement plans.
• Define key metrics and dimensions to accurately track SEO performance and business impact.
• Design, build, regularly assess, and improve reports and dashboards that translate data into actionable insights.
• Provide training for business users on how to use reports and dashboards effectively.
• Perform ad hoc analysis to support business needs and fast decision-making.
• Collaborate with other analytics teams to establish standards and best practices for measurement plans, ensuring consistency and accuracy across projects.

Requirements
• 5+ years of experience in data analytics or related fields, with a preference for experience with web analytics and SEO.
• Proficient in Python, Excel, and SQL.
• Proven experience designing and maintaining dashboards using leading BI tools.
• Strong ability to analyze complex datasets and derive actionable insights.
• Experience in building and optimizing SEO performance dashboards and reports.
• Ability to clearly articulate concepts, solutions, and challenges to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Business-savvy, with the ability to lead interactions with various stakeholders.
• Competent in problem framing and solution design.
• Fluency in English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

What do we offer?
• Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
• Meals Allowance
• Fast growing international company with stable employment
• Annual vacation of 22 working days and 1 additional day off on your birthday
• Healthcare Insurance
• Mental Wellbeing Program – the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions

• Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
• Free English and German language classes
• Referral Program with attractive incentives
• Flexible working hours and hybrid work

Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

job_description:
At ISS Tech Team we are investing in innovative and integrated technological solutions for the Facility Management Industry with a tech team headquarted in Copenhagen, Warsaw and Porto. Our Porto tech hub is the first space dedicated specifically to software development and acts as a powerhouse where our employees test and implement products for over 40,000 clients and 350,000 placemakers around the world.

Are you ready to transform the Integrated Facility Management Industry?

To become the technology leader in the Integrated Facility Management industry (FMS), we're developing digital components connected by AWS and Azure cloud solutions, we build up our machine learning models to make yet better use of our wealth of data, create predictions, and advanced AI for custom Large Language Models (LLM)!

We take care of office buildings worldwide! These offices are increasingly equipped with technology, such as sensors and Internet of Things (IoT) devices, to support a more productive and seamless workday for employees. The purpose of our Porto innovation lab is to develop differentiating, high-quality, and scalable digital solutions for both the ISS enterprise and customers worldwide.

We implement devices all over the place to make the buildings we serve digital and friendly.

Be part of a project to make the world work better!

Are you passionate about making a difference? We’re looking for a Sustainability BI Analyst to join our Global Business Intelligence & Competency Center (BICC) Team in Porto. In this role, you’ll serve as a vital link between our BI capabilities and business objectives, driving tangible value across the organization.

As a key player in fostering a strong data culture, you’ll collaborate with teams in various countries and global key accounts to propel ISS's progress toward our sustainability targets. Your contributions will be essential in delivering accurate reports for corporate reporting, customers, and global benchmarks, ultimately shaping the future of ISS through data.

If you’re ready to make an impact, we want to hear from you!

What will you do:
• BI Expertise: Possesses comprehensive knowledge of reporting and BI frameworks, including data modeling when applicable. Responsible for translating business requirements into technical solutions and functional specifications. Plans, designs, develops, and delivers small-scale BI solutions within an established framework, collaborating closely with source system owners, business subject matter experts, and BI lead developers. In larger BI projects take responsibility for data analysis, functional requirement specification, data quality validation.
• Insight Expertise: Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify and understand the key drivers of sustainability.
• Integrator: Collaborates with the business to gather and translate new requirements into detailed functional specifications for application development. Engages in business process mapping and re-engineering in relation to BI needs, involving subject matter experts in data capture processes. Fosters a strong network to ensure a solid foundation of data and knowledge.
• Enabler: Empowers teams to effectively utilize BI products while promoting knowledge sharing across segments to ensure scalability. Implements initiatives to enhance data literacy and prepare the organization for AI integration.
• Project and Stakeholder Management: Responsible for prioritizing, planning, and delivering business solutions, including managing and mitigating risks associated with change.
• Stakeholder Management: Cultivates strong relationships with relevant stakeholders, coordinating and prioritizing solution delivery. Effectively articulates solutions and breaks down problems by considering the perspectives of different stakeholders.

What makes you a great fit:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Analytics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory.
• Minimum 3-5 years of proven experience in Business Intelligence reporting and data analysis, specifically with Power BI.
• Data Analysis: Proficiency in analyzing large datasets to extract meaningful insights and ability to perform analysis to interpret data trends and patterns.
• Database Management: Knowledge of database technologies such as SQL for querying and managing data.
• Experience with BI tools like Tableau and Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
• Dashboard Creation: Skills in creating interactive dashboards to present data insights effectively.
• Experience in preparing reports, presentations, and visualizations that effectively communicate findings.
• Experience in cross-functional roles, collaborating effectively with diverse teams.
• A passion for environmental sustainability is a plus!
• Excellent interpersonal, communication, listening and presentation skills.
• Ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
• Good organization skills including project management to prioritize tasks and tight deadlines.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.

Nice to have:
• Knowledge of working with Microsoft Fabric.
• Programming: Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis.
• Data Warehousing: Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
• Data Modeling : Competence in data modeling to structure data for analysis.
• Global Experience: Experience in global multinational companies.

Perks:
• 22 days of annual leave per year +3 company leave days.
• Flexible working hours.
• Modern, well-equipped office in the heart the city of Porto.
• Free parking.
• Health Insurance (employee).
• Hybrid working model.
• Free access to company Gym.
• Snacks and drinks at the office.

ISS is a Place to Be You!

Since our founding in 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. We recognize the power of diversity and celebrate the differences that make us unique. When everyone is free to be themselves, everyone benefits. Our people feel safe, respected, represented, and supported as their authentic selves, allowing them to seize opportunities and reach their full potential. We take seriously our obligation to improve lives, make a difference in our communities, and protect our planet — because when we get things right, the world works better. And that is what drives us.

Be who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.

Become more. Become ISS.

job_description:
Service Data Analyst - Trainee Location:

Porto Time Type:
Full time Posted on: Posted 6 Days Ago Job Requisition ID: R17564 Company Overview Euronext is the leading pan
• European market infrastructure, connecting European economies to global capital markets, to accelerate innovation and sustainable growth.
It operates regulated exchanges in Belgium, France, Ireland, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway, and Portugal.

Job Description The Service Data Analyst is responsible for the ongoing service improvement activities within the IT service delivery lifecycle and looks for opportunities to improve the performance of services to deliver enhanced value to the business.

The selected candidate will be part of a team based in Porto and will work in a high-tech, fast learning environment, with colleagues across all Euronext locations.

You will act as an ITIL expert in the analysis and development of existing processes, analytics' procedures and methods to promote effective business intelligence and systems operations through standardization, automation, and data integration and modeling.

You will establish strong and productive relationships with key stakeholders ensuring that the service requirements of the business are incorporated into a framework of continuous improvement.
Key Accountabilities Developing Large Data Models to provide stakeholders with valuable Business Intelligence. Creating RPA solutions to increase the efficiency of the established workflows. Analyzing the service delivery process. Gathering and assessing KPIs, reporting process performance information to recommend, develop and implement improvements. Ensuring standardization and efficiency in workflows. Develop and document Service Data Analytics' own procedures and tools. Provide support and guidance to the technical teams as they implement service management policies, ensuring quality throughout the implementation.

Prepare and conduct training sessions to establish new tools and procedures, presenting them to a wide range of stakeholders within the company.
Creative thinking and presenting ideas for business improvement.

Profile and Skills Essential:
Degree in a related field
• IEFP Level VI.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written.

English is a must, as it will be used on a daily basis to communicate with other teams and stakeholders.
Excellent interpersonal skills.

An affinity with Microsoft Office applications:
Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc

Desirable:
Interest in financial markets. Awareness of ITIL framework and processes. Knowledge of programming language (SQL/Python/DAX/MDX/PowerQuery). Experience in RPA and business analytics tools (such as Power Automate and Power BI). Soft Skills A hands-on mentality and a structured way of working. The ambition and potential to develop a successful IT career. Ability to multi-task and prioritize. Strong awareness and interest in technology. Superb problem-solving skills. Solution-oriented attitude

job_description:
Job Description:

Responsibilities - your mission:

Airbus is preparing for a successful future and for the next generation of zero-emission aircraft with the implementation of a new industrial setup. It will lay the foundation of Airbus' future entrepreneurial success and thus contribute to long-term job security.

At the heart of this new industrial setup is the bundling of all aerostructures assembly activities in a strong aerostructures assembly company in Germany. Combining these activities is intended to make processes more efficient, stabilize the industrial system and improve competitiveness in the long term.

You will be working within the procurement team of Airbus Aerostructure (ASA). The team is responsible for a large number of central purchasing activities, supply chain quality and other activities like process management, data analytics or digitalisation.

In your role as ASA Procurement Data Analyst you will be responsible for identifying, supporting and providing solutions to data analytics needs for ASA Procurement. It will also give you the opportunity to discover many key strategic projects/initiatives and work with many different stakeholders within and outside of ASA Procurement.

Main responsibilities:
• Capture and analyze data analytics needs from the business
• Data preparation, data modeling, data science, reporting and dashboarding
• Support the definition, enhancement and implementation of a procurement data model
• Develop proof of concepts/prototypes with a strong focus on predictive and prescriptive analytics to support existing and new initiatives e.g. Supply Chain Digital Twin, Artificial Intelligence
• Develop, test and implement the most suitable analytical models to identify meaningful patterns or trends from complex data sets and types
• Analyze and improve regularly the accuracy of models against business needs
• Communicate findings through effective and easy-to-understand data visualizations
• Support the coaching of the teams in the data-driven mind-set
• Actively contribute and share best practices, findings, and techniques with the wider data community
• Eliminate non-added value activities by proactively automating recurrent analytics and performance management tasks

Requirements - our ideal candidate will have/be:
• Education to degree level (or equivalent) in Data Analytics, IT or Business Administration with specialization in statistics, business intelligence, advanced data analytics / Big data business project deployment and/ or Procurement and/or Information technology or related discipline
• Interested in data, curious about how to help others understanding what you do
• Data analysis skills (such as Python, Palantir Foundry (Skywise) ,Jupyter, SQL/SQL Server, Qliksense, SAP Lumira Designer…)
• Mathematics, Statistics, Economics knowledge
• Ability to analyze large datasets
• Team player with entrepreneurial mindset
• Good communication and presentation skills at all levels
• Strong ability to interact and Influence
• Basic experience in project management
• Language Skills: Negotiation level of English, German would be a plus
• open to some travel (mainly Germany) as required

Benefits - what’s in it for you:
• Diverse career opportunities within Airbus European core countries or in other regions around the world.
• A hybrid working model, allowing you to combine onsite and offsite work.
• A modern office well connected to public transportation.
• A motivated and fun crew to grow and build and shape the GBS together.
• An intense and exciting onboarding experience.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:
Airbus Portugal SA

Employment Type:
Permanent

-------

Experience Level:
Professional

Job Family:
Digital

job_description:
About the job
• As Chief Operating Officer (COO) team, we assist our different business team in multiple topics, both on daily/monthly needs as in project mode. Within the COO team we have a small team of data scientists focusing on data, who are involved in the data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery.
• We are looking for a junior business data analyst to join the COO team to provide assistance in the automation of our business monitoring reports and enhance and leverage our data capabilities.

Your Main Activities Are
• Automate business dashboards as prototypes and prepare them to be put in production, working closely with the team´s data analysts
• Report to Top line TB Management and TB COO on all data queries and data needs.
• Contribute to the development and governance of our data and support the different business lines with data-driven decision-making
• Meet different stakeholders to frame their data needs, based on your findings collect the necessary data, process the data, and turn it into meaningful tools meeting the requirements expressed by the teams
• Participate and interact with inter-disciplinary teams (IT, Business, Operations) and contribute to the improvement and streamlining of data systems within the company to drive innovation

Profile and Skills to Success
• Academic background in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management, Business Intelligence, Business, Economics or Mathematics
• Fluency in English
• Highly proficient with MS Excel
• Ability to quickly comprehend new software tools and learn how to use them optimally
• Great attention to detail
• Excellent interpersonal, communication and influence skills
• Good conceptualization skills and data exposure
• Open, curious and eager to learn and discover day to day banking products

#LI-Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?

· Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

· Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.
• International reach

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success. BNP Paribas holds key positions in its three core operating divisions:
• Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
• Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
• Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
• Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.
• Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.
• Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
• Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
• In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

job_description:
About Jumia :

Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses.

Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing
• Lead the execution of data analysis projects, including collecting specifications, creating dashboards, and conducting in-depth analyses to drive business decisions
• Develop and maintain complex SQL queries, Power BI dashboards, and Excel models to support various business units
• Mentor and support junior colleagues in data analysis techniques, query optimization, and dashboard creation • Perform quality assurance on data outputs, including queries, dashboard results, and visualizations to ensure accuracy and reliability
• Communicate analytical findings and insights to senior stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable manner • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to standardize processes, improve team performance, and enhance overall efficiency
• Assist the team manager in handling ad-hoc requests and managing cross-team projects
• Contribute to the development of best practices and documentation for data analysis processes.

What we are looking for
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the e-commerce or retail sector
• Advanced proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Excel; familiarity with JIRA and Confluence is a plus
• Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining complex dashboards and conducting in-depth data analysis
• Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
• Experience in mentoring junior team members and contributing to process improvements
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
• Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and KPIs is highly desirable
• Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and data visualization best practices
• This job description outlines the key responsibilities and requirements for a Senior Data Analyst at Jumia, emphasizing the technical skills, leadership qualities, and industry knowledge needed for success in this role.

We Offer :
• A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
• A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
• The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
• An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.

job_description:
Description

The Company

WTW is an award-winning advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth.

From the Titanic ship in 1912 to The Moon Buggy in 1971, WTW has a richness in [insurance] history dating back to 1828.

Our WTW Regional Delivery Hub based in the heart of Lisbon - encompasses a +175 strong global team of who deliver operational excellence through innovation and streamlined solutions every single day.

The Role

The Sales Analyst will align with WTW’s broader sales analytics strategy to execute requirements (for all WTW, including specific segments and businesses). This role will partner closely with the broader sales analytics team to improve the overall effectiveness of our data model and sales insights to support decision-making and go-to-market strategies. This role will foster growth by improving our sales analytics to provide predictive analytics on sales trends, pipeline, and connectivity across businesses.

Main functions will be:
• Partner with businesses as a global analyst with Power BI, excel power query, financial acumen skills.
• Experience with Microsoft tools, particularly above-average expertise in Microsoft Dynamics, Power BI, Power query/excel.
• Ability to identify data inaccuracies and raise issues as required.
• Proficiency in cleansing large data sets and utilizing internal enterprise data sources for mapping requirements.
• Understanding of the data model applied to business and geography.
• PM changes required in data models and make suggestions on improvements in communicating analytics

Qualifications

The Requirements

You are the person that we are looking for if you have:
• Previous experience with data research and sales data analytics
• Expertise in Excel and PowerBI
• Understanding of CRM systems and data lakes
• Strong project management and analytical skills
• Technically savvy
• Ability to coordinate teams across businesses and internal stakeholders.
• Team-oriented and collaborative
• Broad understanding of WTW capabilities and expertise

What’s in it for you?

In WTW, you’ll find a professional yet friendly and easy-going environment in an office based in a fast-growing European capital. Come join a team of dynamic and motivating colleagues!

In addition to our attractive remuneration package, we offer:

Work-life balance. Mobile working or in the office? Flexible working hours? Sure, no problem. Hybrid working is more than just a buzzword for us.

Monetary benefit. An attractive, performance-related remuneration system.

Internationality. An international management consultancy and the security of a global corporation with renowned customers.

Development opportunities. A steep learning curve and sufficient freedom for individual career development: You will dive deep into a variety of topics, both on-the-job and in intensive specialist training.

Cooperation. Learning from each other and making decisions together, collegial, appreciative, and dynamic.

Customer contact. Quickly take responsibility.

Corporate events. Together we celebrate our successes and our community.

Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer

job_description:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models.

The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world.

Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects.
We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community.

We are hiring freelance (English & Portuguese speaking) Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally.

The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available.
You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.
G. verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.
RequirementsFull Professional Proficiency in English & PortugueseYou must be living in Portugal for the last 2 consecutive yearsAbility to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps, and website informationYou must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in PortugalBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.
G. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment).
This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyleBetter work-life balanceBe your own bossRemote work & location independenceComplimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.

Be part of an online communityWhat's next?If this sounds like a role you'd be interested in taking on, please apply below.

job_description:
About the job
• The Business Analytics Trainee main mission is to perform the analysis of financial data such as C3 information or risk indicators, preparing the reports for the Coverage Departments and Country Head. Also, the trainee must ensure the support to the Coverage department by providing extractions and analyzing the commercial activity of the bankers

Your Main Activities Are
• Ensure the data integrity of the portfolios are correct in Commercial and Referential tools, namely in CRM and RMPM:
• Confirm the Relationship Manager (RM) or Senior Business Officer (SBO) name and role are the same
• Confirm the Coverage line of the Legal Entity (LE)
• Update the Coverage line of LE and Business Group (BG) in RMPM when necessary and accordingly with instructions received by the Coverage team
• Coordinate with Due Diligence teams (DDT) or Client Management (CLM) according with the management entity of LE and BG, among others
• Check and update Pilot or Contributors positions
• Initiate and undertake cleaning actions for portfolios and pipeline
• Support to prospect creation in CRM, knowing that a Banker can easily create a prospect, and control of correct merging when appropriate
• Provide support for CRM
• Produce, on monthly a basis, report on calendar of visits and pipeline:
• Provide to bankers a pipeline extraction, before the production of monthly report, in order to ensure quality of pipeline in CRM
• Produce a monthly activity reports revenues, budget achievements and risk return analysis
• Analyzing the top to bottom movers from one month to another, allowing to fix errors or data quality issues very quickly
• Investigate missing revenues, making the bridge between finance team and métiers
• Support Ad-hoc reports, whenever the information is related with C3 information and CRM
• Support Ad-hoc request for cases when revenues are not reported correctly, such as revenues missing
• Help to prepare presentations associated with the Territory budget for head office
• Support the Coverage and Head of Coverage making the consolidation of budget and analysing the figures in Systems

Profile and Skills to Success
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Management, Economics or any related field
• Fluency in English, both written and oral
• Comfort using Microsoft Office Tools, particularly Excel
• Knowledge in Power BI
• Great team spirit with a results driven mindset
• Critical thinking, attention to detail and analytical ability

#LI-Hybrid
Why joining BNP Paribas?
• Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.
• Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.
• International reach

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success. BNP Paribas holds key positions in its three core operating divisions:
• Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
• Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
• Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
• Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.
• Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.
• Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.
To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
• Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered
• In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process

job_description:
Position Snapshot Location:

Lisbon, Portugal Full-time / Hybrid mode Fluent in EnglishPosition Summary The Consumer Engagement Services (CES) Analytics Specialist will be monitoring of digital and social media channels, collecting, structuring, and analyzing data from multiple sources to support Brands and Functions with reputation management, consumer engagement, social insights, and content marketing.
A day in the life of...
• Ensure all relevant data is processed, labelled and structured accurately in corresponding digital and media analytics tool
• Engage with the consumers using the most adequate form of communication for each social media channel
• Monitor the conversations in our platforms and across our competitors to provide actionable insights to the stakeholders to support the messaging and content creation processes
• Deliver datadriven conclusions, creating reports, dashboards or presentations according to Omnichannel analysis to address business answers (eg. Social brand equity, report, analysis of marketing campaign performance, analysis and insight on brand ecosystem, etc.)
• Perform adhoc analytics to deliver reliable insights and findings relevant for stakeholders, taking initiative to present solutions
• Predict the potential reputation risks to be able to alert the respective Brands in order to prevent escalations and provide support in issue management
• Work closely with team members and partners to identify opportunities for improvement and execute analytic projects, supporting them in performance objectives meetings
• Set alignment calls with Market Partners to keep them updated of the analytics' processWhat will make you successful
• Bachelor or master's degree in IT, Business Studies, Marketing, similar;
• Experience working in a major BPO or Consumer Engagement environment;
• Experience with SocialMedia listening tools (eg. Social Studio, Socialbakers, Sprinklr, TalkWalker, Google Analytics or similar) is a plus;
• Ability to work with large volumes of data, performing qualitative and quantitative analysis
• Strong Excel knowledge
• Proficient user of Microsoft Office Word, PowerPoint
• Knowledge in data visualization tools as PowerBI
• Proficiency in English (spoken and written)
• Capable of problem solving and attention to detailWhat we offer Here at NBS Lisbon we care about our Talents, and we continuously work to have our teams engaged and our people achieving their best professional performance, without forgetting personal development and worklife balance

job_description:
VIE eBusiness Data Analyst – Lisbon, H/F
Concrètement votre quotidien ?

L'équipe Smart Derivatives Support se situe au coeur de l'offre digitale en matière de trading électronique de BNP Paribas. Sa fonction première est de fournir un point de contact unique pour les demandes clients relatives aux produits et services électroniques. ECS fournit un support aux clients, plateformes de trading et aux contreparties externes. Le département est responsable de l’enregistrement des clients sur nos outils digitaux, du support clients et de la relation avec les fournisseurs pour l’ensemble des plateformes eCommerce. Smart Derivatives team est un élément essentiel du département Electronic Business & Markets. Il vise à fournir le meilleur niveau de service possible à nos clients internes ou externes afin de positionner BNP Paribas en tant que leader du business des marchés électroniques.

L'équipe est responsable de :
• la gestion et de l’implémentation des requêtes d’enregistrement client ou utilisateur interne sur les plateformes de trading électronique de BNP Paribas, SmartDertivatives et BRIO,
• assurer que les connexions des clients sont opérationnelles - possibilité de pricer et traiter en permanence.
• fournir un support aux clients et former les différentes équipes afin d’assurer un usage optimal de la plateforme.
• Proposer et rédiger de nouvelle brochure marketing pour la promotion de nos plateformes et de ses nouveaux services.
• S’assurer que tous les guides relatifs aux fonctionnalités des plateformes disponibles en ligne sont exhaustifs et à jour.
• Former et présenter aux utilisateurs internes les nouveautés des plateformes lors de leur mise à disposition.

L'équipe est aussi impliquée dans plusieurs projets d'optimisation eBusiness, et dirige ceux directement lié à la BAU et au développement de la plateforme.
L'environnement de travail, c'est important !

Au sein des équipes CIB de BNP Paribas, Global Markets offre une gamme très large de produits et services sur les marchés des taux d'intérêts, du crédit, des devises, des matières premières et des marchés actions. GM aide ses clients à trouver des solutions efficaces et adaptées pour lever et investir des capitaux ainsi que pour gérer les expositions aux différents risques de marchés. Notre base de clientèle est très large et comprend des centaines d’entreprises, d’investisseurs institutionnels, de banques, de gouvernements ou d’organisations supranationales. GM a la possibilité d’entretenir des relations professionnelles partout dans le monde et d’émettre des produits dans la quasi-totalité des devises. Notre réseau regroupe plus de 3000 professionnels repartis sur toute la planète.

Basée à Lisbonne, votre équipe est une équipe globale appartenant au COO Group avec des équipes basées à Londres, Lisbonne, New York et Singapour, sur les activités ECS, et Digital Sales.

ECS assiste les clients de BNP Paribas sur les plateformes mono ou multi émetteurs/contreparties (Single dealer and Multi dealer platforms) en partenariat avec la vente et le trading.

Le rôle principal de l’équipe Digital Sales est de promouvoir l’offre digitale BNPP auprès de nouveaux clients ainsi que des clients européens existants. Ce rôle est clé afin de poursuivre la croissance de notre franchise et d’aider le business à atteindre les objectifs stratégiques digitaux.
Et après ?

Vous aurez l’opportunité de développer vos connaissances sur une large étendue de produits financiers (principalement structurés et dérivés actions) mais aussi sur l’offre digitale de BNPP. Vous développerez un sens du contact client et êtes amené à interagir avec de nombreux intervenants externes et internes dans un environnement stimulant sous pression. Vous serez responsable d’un certain nombre de projets dans lesquels vous serez confronté à différents outils d’automatisation. Enfin, vous interviendrez au sein de la salle des marchés et serez au contact avec l’ensemble des équipes Front Office ( Sales, Traders, Structuration, Developpeurs) ce qui vous permettra d’acquérir une vue d’ensemble sur le fonctionnement de l’activité au sens large.
Pourquoi rejoindre BNP Paribas ?

Notre monde change : notre manière de nous informer, de consommer… et de travailler aussi ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable. Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.

Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur https://group.bnpparibas
Et la rémunération ?

Elle est fixée par Business France et consultable directement sur leur site.
Etes-vous notre prochain VIE eBusiness Data Analyst ?

A vous de nous convaincre !

Vous êtes titulaire d’un Master avec une spécialisation en Mathématiques, en Finance, en Economie ou en Ingénierie, et vous justifiez d’une expérience de 12 mois minimum (stage et alternance inclus) sur un poste similaire.

Vous parlez couramment anglais. Vous maîtrisez le Pack Office (Excel) avez des compétences en langage informatique tel que Python. Vous avez des connaissances en banque d’investissement, en analyse de données, en marchés des actions et en marchés financiers transversaux.

De plus, votre adaptabilité et votre rigueur seront des atouts essentiels. Ajoutez à cela votre esprit d’équipe, votre esprit critique, ainsi que votre capacité à communiquer pour finir de nous convaincre.

Dans un monde qui change, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs clés pour le bien-être et la performance des équipes. Chez BNP Paribas, nous souhaitons accueillir et retenir tous les talents sans distinction : c’est ainsi que nous construirons, ensemble, la finance de demain, innovante, responsable et durable.

Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.

A tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d’identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiées.
Durée et disponibilité

Ce poste est à pourvoir à partir du 1er novembre pour une durée de 24 mois.

Avant de postuler, veillez à vérifier les conditions d’éligibilité pour cette destination : Faire son V.I.E au Portugal (businessfrance.fr) et ajouter à votre espace candidat un CV en anglais.

job_description:
Financial Master Data Analyst role at Essity Global Business Services involves creating and maintaining financial master data, ensuring quality and accuracy, and collaborating with global teams.

As a key member of the Master Data Services team, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining financial master data, ensuring quality and accuracy, and collaborating with global teams.

Key responsibilities include:
• Communicate and support the Master Data vision, including global harmonization and a single Master Data process.
• Understand global Master Data policies and procedures and ensure adherence to Financial Master Data processes.
• Train and communicate with Essity's business functions to ensure appropriate involvement and understanding of the global Financial Master Data set.
• Coordinate testing activities in projects and in the run phase.
• Monitor and review Financial Master Data flows ensuring appropriate quality and accuracy.
• Highlight issues and recommend improvement activities.
• Respond to complex enquiries from team members and develop problem-solving guidelines to improve problem resolution.
• Proactively contribute to projects and initiatives, challenging the status quo.
• Actively perform mass upload Master Data in conjunction with the IT group.
• Develop and calculate KPI's, ad hoc reporting and data analysis.
• Implement desired workflow tools or automation systems across all geographies.

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a relevant area.
• Three plus years of experience within Finance, specifically in Accounting.
• Proven proficiency with Excel.
• Experience in Financial Master Data is highly preferred.
• Experience with SAP, specifically having worked with MDG/S4Hana is highly preferred.
• Analytical mindset.
• Eager to learn and share.
